Item.name: activePose
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: mask
Item.description: Two character body-masking value, bitwise joint mask or bitwise logic string of two character body-masking value (see notes for explanation)

Item.name: useGravityCompensation
Item.description: Apply gravity compensation as well?

Item.name: animSource
Item.description: AnimSource 0 = CurrentItms, 1 = PreviousItms, 2 = AnimItms

Item.name: applyImpulse
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: equalizeAmount
Item.description: 0 means straight impulse, 1 means multiply by the mass (change in velocity)

Item.name: partIndex
Item.description: index of part being hit. -1 apply impulse to COM.

Item.name: impulse
Item.description: impulse vector (impulse is change in momentum)

Item.name: hitPoint
Item.description: optional point on part where hit. If not supplied then the impulse is applied at the part centre.

Item.name: localHitPointInfo
Item.description: hitPoint in local coordinates of bodyPart

Item.name: localImpulseInfo
Item.description: impulse in local coordinates of bodyPart

Item.name: angularImpulse
Item.description: impulse should be considered an angular impulse

Item.name: applyBulletImpulse
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: equalizeAmount
Item.description: 0 means straight impulse, 1 means multiply by the mass (change in velocity)

Item.name: partIndex
Item.description: index of part being hit.

Item.name: impulse
Item.description: impulse vector (impulse is change in momentum)

Item.name: hitPoint
Item.description: optional point on part where hit

Item.name: localHitPointInfo
Item.description: true = hitPoint is in local coordinates of bodyPart, false = hitpoint is in world coordinates

Item.name: extraShare
Item.description: if not 0.0 then have an extra bullet applied to spine0 (approximates the COM). Uses setup from configureBulletsExtra. 0-1 shared 0.0 = no extra bullet, 0.5 = impulse split equally between extra and bullet, 1.0 only extra bullet. LT 0.0 then bullet + scaled extra bullet. Eg.-0.5 = bullet + 0.5 impulse extra bullet

Item.name: bodyRelax
Item.description: bodyRelax: Set the amount of relaxation across the whole body; Used to collapse the character into a rag-doll-like state.

Item.name: relaxation
Item.description: How relaxed the body becomes, in percentage relaxed. 100 being totally rag-dolled, 0 being very stiff and rigid.

Item.name: mask
Item.description: Two character body-masking value, bitwise joint mask or bitwise logic string of two character body-masking value (see Active Pose notes for possible values)

Item.name: holdPose
Item.description: automatically hold the current pose as the character relaxes - can be used to avoid relaxing into a t-pose

Item.name: disableJointDriving
Item.description: sets the drive state to free - this reduces drifting on the ground

Item.name: configureBalance
Item.description: configureBalance: This single message allows you to configure various parameters used on any behaviour that uses the dynamic balance.

Item.name: stepHeight
Item.description: maximum height that character steps vertically (above 0.2 is high...but ok for say underwater)

Item.name: stepHeightInc4Step
Item.description: added to stepHeight if going up steps

Item.name: legsApartRestep
Item.description: if the legs end up more than (legsApartRestep + hipwidth) apart even though balanced, take another step

Item.name: legsTogetherRestep
Item.description: mmmm0.1 for drunk if the legs end up less than (hipwidth - legsTogetherRestep) apart even though balanced, take another step. A value of 1 will turn off this feature and the max value is hipWidth = 0.23f by default but is model dependent

Item.name: legsApartMax
Item.description: FRICTION WORKAROUND: if the legs end up more than (legsApartMax + hipwidth) apart when balanced, adjust the feet positions to slide back so they are legsApartMax + hipwidth apart. Needs to be less than legsApartRestep to see any effect

Item.name: taperKneeStrength
Item.description: does the knee strength reduce with angle

Item.name: legStiffness
Item.description: stiffness of legs

Item.name: leftLegSwingDamping
Item.description: damping of left leg during swing phase (mmmmDrunk used 1.25 to slow legs movement)

Item.name: rightLegSwingDamping
Item.description: damping of right leg during swing phase (mmmmDrunk used 1.25 to slow legs movement)

Item.name: opposeGravityLegs
Item.description: Gravity opposition applied to hips and knees

Item.name: opposeGravityAnkles
Item.description: Gravity opposition applied to ankles. General balancer likes 1.0. StaggerFall likes 0.1

Item.name: leanAcc
Item.description: Multiplier on the floorAcceleration added to the lean

Item.name: hipLeanAcc
Item.description: Multiplier on the floorAcceleration added to the leanHips

Item.name: leanAccMax
Item.description: Max floorAcceleration allowed for lean and leanHips

Item.name: resistAcc
Item.description: Level of cheat force added to character to resist the effect of floorAcceleration (anti-Acceleration) - added to upperbody.

Item.name: resistAccMax
Item.description: Max floorAcceleration allowed for anti-Acceleration. If GT 20.0 then it is probably in a crash

Item.name: footSlipCompOnMovingFloor
Item.description: This parameter will be removed when footSlipCompensation preserves the foot angle on a moving floor]. If the character detects a moving floor and footSlipCompOnMovingFloor is false then it will turn off footSlipCompensation - at footSlipCompensation preserves the global heading of the feet. If footSlipCompensation is off then the character usually turns to the side in the end although when turning the vehicle turns it looks promising for a while

Item.name: ankleEquilibrium
Item.description: ankle equilibrium angle used when static balancing

Item.name: extraFeetApart
Item.description: additional feet apart setting

Item.name: dontStepTime
Item.description: amount of time at the start of a balance before the character is allowed to start stepping

Item.name: balanceAbortThreshold
Item.description: when the character gives up and goes into a fall. Larger values mean that the balancer can lean more before failing.

Item.name: giveUpHeight
Item.description: height between lowest foot and COM below which balancer will give up

Item.name: stepClampScaleVariance
Item.description: Variance in clamp scale every step. if negative only takes away from clampScale

Item.name: predictionTimeHip
Item.description: amount of time (seconds) into the future that the character tries to move hip to (kind of). Will be controlled by balancer in future but can help recover spine quicker from bending forwards to much.

Item.name: predictionTime
Item.description: amount of time (seconds) into the future that the character tries to step to. bigger values try to recover with fewer, bigger steps. smaller values recover with smaller steps, and generally recover less.

Item.name: predictionTimeVariance
Item.description: Variance in predictionTime every step. if negative only takes away from predictionTime

Item.name: maxSteps
Item.description: Maximum number of steps that the balancer will take.

Item.name: maxBalanceTime
Item.description: Maximum time(seconds) that the balancer will balance for.

Item.name: extraSteps
Item.description: Allow the balancer to take this many more steps before hitting maxSteps. If negative nothing happens(safe default)

Item.name: extraTime
Item.description: Allow the balancer to balance for this many more seconds before hitting maxBalanceTime. If negative nothing happens(safe default)

Item.name: fallType
Item.description: How to fall after maxSteps or maxBalanceTime: 0=rampDown stiffness, 1= 0 and dontChangeStep, 2= 0 and forceBalance, 3=0 and slump (BCR has to be active)

Item.name: fallMult
Item.description: Multiply the rampDown of stiffness on falling by this amount ( GT 1 fall quicker)

Item.name: fallReduceGravityComp
Item.description: Reduce gravity compensation as the legs weaken on falling

Item.name: rampHipPitchOnFail
Item.description: bend over when falling after maxBalanceTime

Item.name: stableLinSpeedThresh
Item.description: Linear speed threshold for successful balance.

Item.name: stableRotSpeedThresh
Item.description: Rotational speed threshold for successful balance.

Item.name: failMustCollide
Item.description: The upper body of the character must be colliding and other failure conditions met to fail

Item.name: ignoreFailure
Item.description: Ignore maxSteps and maxBalanceTime and try to balance forever

Item.name: changeStepTime
Item.description: time not in contact (airborne) before step is changed. If -ve don't change step

Item.name: balanceIndefinitely
Item.description: Ignore maxSteps and maxBalanceTime and try to balance forever

Item.name: movingFloor
Item.description: temporary variable to ignore movingFloor code that generally causes the character to fall over if the feet probe a moving object e.g. treading on a gun

Item.name: airborneStep
Item.description: when airborne try to step. Set to false for e.g. shotGun reaction

Item.name: useComDirTurnVelThresh
Item.description: Velocity below which the balancer turns in the direction of the COM forward instead of the ComVel - for use with shot from running with high upright constraint use 1.9

Item.name: minKneeAngle
Item.description: Minimum knee angle (-ve value will mean this functionality is not applied). 0.4 seems a good value

Item.name: avoidLeg
Item.description: If true then balancer tries to avoid leg2leg collisions/avoid crossing legs. Avoid tries to not step across a line of the inside of the stance leg's foot

Item.name: avoidFootWidth
Item.description: NB. Very sensitive. Avoid tries to not step across a line of the inside of the stance leg's foot. avoidFootWidth = how much inwards from the ankle this line is in (m).

Item.name: avoidFeedback
Item.description: NB. Very sensitive. Avoid tries to not step across a line of the inside of the stance leg's foot. Avoid doesn't allow the desired stepping foot to cross the line. avoidFeedback = how much of the actual crossing of that line is fedback as an error.

Item.name: stepIfInSupport
Item.description: The balancer sometimes decides to step even if balanced

Item.name: standUp
Item.description: standup more with increased velocity

Item.name: depthFudge
Item.description: Supposed to increase foot friction: Impact depth of a collision with the foot is changed when the balancer is running - impact.SetDepth(impact.GetDepth() - depthFudge)

Item.name: depthFudgeStagger
Item.description: Supposed to increase foot friction: Impact depth of a collision with the foot is changed when staggerFall is running - impact.SetDepth(impact.GetDepth() - depthFudgeStagger)

Item.name: footFriction
Item.description: Foot friction multiplier is multiplied by this amount if balancer is running

Item.name: footFrictionStagger
Item.description: Foot friction multiplier is multiplied by this amount if staggerFall is running

Item.name: backwardsLeanCutoff
Item.description: Backwards lean threshold to cut off stay upright forces. 0.0 Vertical - 1.0 horizontal. 0.6 is a sensible value. NB: the balancer does not fail in order to give stagger that extra step as it falls. A backwards lean of GT 0.6 will generally mean the balancer will soon fail without stayUpright forces.

Item.name: giveUpHeightEnd
Item.description: if this value is different from giveUpHeight, actual giveUpHeight will be ramped toward this value

Item.name: balanceAbortThresholdEnd
Item.description: if this value is different from balanceAbortThreshold, actual balanceAbortThreshold will be ramped toward this value

Item.name: giveUpRampDuration
Item.description: duration of ramp from start of behaviour for above two parameters. If smaller than 0, no ramp is applied

Item.name: leanToAbort
Item.description: lean at which to send abort message when maxSteps or maxBalanceTime is reached

Item.name: configureBalanceReset
Item.description: configureBalanceReset: reset the values configurable by the Configure Balance message to their defaults.

Item.name: configureSelfAvoidance
Item.description: configureSelfAvoidance: this single message allows to configure self avoidance for the character.BBDD Self avoidance tech.

Item.name: useSelfAvoidance
Item.description: Enable or disable self avoidance tech.

Item.name: overwriteDragReduction
Item.description: Specify whether self avoidance tech should use original IK input target or the target that has been already modified by getStabilisedPos() tech i.e. function that compensates for rotational and linear velocity of shoulder/thigh.

Item.name: torsoSwingFraction
Item.description: Place the adjusted target this much along the arc between effector (wrist) and target, value in range [0,1].

Item.name: maxTorsoSwingAngleRad
Item.description: Max value on the effector (wrist) to adjusted target offset.

Item.name: selfAvoidIfInSpineBoundsOnly
Item.description: Restrict self avoidance to operate on targets that are within character torso bounds only.

Item.name: selfAvoidAmount
Item.description: Amount of self avoidance offset applied when angle from effector (wrist) to target is greater then right angle i.e. when total offset is a blend between where effector currently is to value that is a product of total arm length and selfAvoidAmount. SelfAvoidAmount is in a range between [0, 1].

Item.name: overwriteTwist
Item.description: Overwrite desired IK twist with self avoidance procedural twist.

Item.name: usePolarPathAlgorithm
Item.description: Use the alternative self avoidance algorithm that is based on linear and polar target blending. WARNING: It only requires "radius" in terms of parametrization.

Item.name: radius
Item.description: Self avoidance radius, measured out from the spine axis along the plane perpendicular to that axis. The closer is the proximity of reaching target to that radius, the more polar (curved) motion is used for offsetting the target. WARNING: Parameter only used by the alternative algorithm that is based on linear and polar target blending.

Item.name: configureBullets
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: impulseSpreadOverParts
Item.description: spreads impulse across parts. currently only for spine parts, not limbs.

Item.name: impulseLeakageStrengthScaled
Item.description: for weaker characters subsequent impulses remain strong

Item.name: impulsePeriod
Item.description: duration that impulse is spread over (triangular shaped)

Item.name: impulseTorqueScale
Item.description: An impulse applied at a point on a body equivalent to an impulse at the centre of the body and a torque. This parameter scales the torque component. (The torque component seems to be excite the rage looseness bug which sends the character in a sometimes wildly different direction to an applied impulse)

Item.name: loosenessFix
Item.description: Fix the rage looseness bug by applying only the impulse at the centre of the body unless it is a spine part then apply the twist component only of the torque as well.

Item.name: impulseDelay
Item.description: time from hit before impulses are being applied

Item.name: impulseReductionPerShot
Item.description: by how much are subsequent impulses reduced (e.g. 0.0: no reduction, 0.1: 10% reduction each new hit)

Item.name: impulseRecovery
Item.description: recovery rate of impulse strength per second (impulse strength from 0.0:1.0). At 60fps a impulseRecovery=60.0 will recover in 1 frame

Item.name: impulseMinLeakage
Item.description: the minimum amount of impulse leakage allowed

Item.name: torqueMode
Item.description: 0: Disabled | 1: character strength proportional (can reduce impulse amount) | 2: Additive (no reduction of impulse and not proportional to character strength)

Item.name: torqueSpinMode
Item.description: 0: spin direction from impulse direction | 1: random direction | 2: direction flipped with each bullet (for burst effect)

Item.name: torqueFilterMode
Item.description: 0: apply torque for every bullet | 1: only apply new torque if previous has finished | 2: Only apply new torque if its spin direction is different from previous torque

Item.name: torqueAlwaysSpine3
Item.description: always apply torques to spine3 instead of actual part hit

Item.name: torqueDelay
Item.description: time from hit before torques are being applied

Item.name: torquePeriod
Item.description: duration of torque

Item.name: torqueGain
Item.description: multiplies impulse magnitude to arrive at torque that is applied

Item.name: torqueCutoff
Item.description: minimum ratio of impulse that remains after converting to torque (if in strength-proportional mode)

Item.name: torqueReductionPerTick
Item.description: ratio of torque for next tick (e.g. 1.0: not reducing over time, 0.9: each tick torque is reduced by 10%)

Item.name: liftGain
Item.description: amount of lift (directly multiplies torque axis to give lift force)

Item.name: counterImpulseDelay
Item.description: time after impulse is applied that counter impulse is applied

Item.name: counterImpulseMag
Item.description: amount of the original impulse that is countered

Item.name: counterAfterMagReached
Item.description: applies the counter impulse counterImpulseDelay(secs) after counterImpulseMag of the Impulse has been applied

Item.name: doCounterImpulse
Item.description: add a counter impulse to the pelvis

Item.name: counterImpulse2Hips
Item.description: amount of the counter impulse applied to hips - the rest is applied to the part originally hit

Item.name: impulseNoBalMult
Item.description: amount to scale impulse by if the dynamicBalance is not OK. 1.0 means this functionality is not applied.

Item.name: impulseBalStabStart
Item.description: 100% LE Start to impulseBalStabMult*100% GT End. NB: Start LT End

Item.name: impulseBalStabEnd
Item.description: 100% LE Start to impulseBalStabMult*100% GT End. NB: Start LT End

Item.name: impulseBalStabMult
Item.description: 100% LE Start to impulseBalStabMult*100% GT End. NB: leaving this as 1.0 means this functionality is not applied and Start and End have no effect.

Item.name: impulseSpineAngStart
Item.description: 100% GE Start to impulseSpineAngMult*100% LT End. NB: Start GT End. This the dot of hip2Head with up.

Item.name: impulseSpineAngEnd
Item.description: 100% GE Start to impulseSpineAngMult*100% LT End. NB: Start GT End. This the dot of hip2Head with up.

Item.name: impulseSpineAngMult
Item.description: 100% GE Start to impulseSpineAngMult*100% LT End. NB: leaving this as 1.0 means this functionality is not applied and Start and End have no effect.

Item.name: impulseVelStart
Item.description: 100% LE Start to impulseVelMult*100% GT End. NB: Start LT End

Item.name: impulseVelEnd
Item.description: 100% LE Start to impulseVelMult*100% GT End. NB: Start LT End

Item.name: impulseVelMult
Item.description: 100% LE Start to impulseVelMult*100% GT End. NB: leaving this as 1.0 means this functionality is not applied and Start and End have no effect.

Item.name: impulseAirMult
Item.description: amount to scale impulse by if the character is airborne and dynamicBalance is OK and impulse is above impulseAirMultStart

Item.name: impulseAirMultStart
Item.description: if impulse is above this value scale it by impulseAirMult

Item.name: impulseAirMax
Item.description: amount to clamp impulse to if character is airborne and dynamicBalance is OK

Item.name: impulseAirApplyAbove
Item.description: if impulse is above this amount then do not scale/clamp just let it through as is - it's a shotgun or cannon

Item.name: impulseAirOn
Item.description: scale and/or clamp impulse if the character is airborne and dynamicBalance is OK

Item.name: impulseOneLegMult
Item.description: amount to scale impulse by if the character is contacting with one foot only and dynamicBalance is OK and impulse is above impulseAirMultStart

Item.name: impulseOneLegMultStart
Item.description: if impulse is above this value scale it by impulseOneLegMult

Item.name: impulseOneLegMax
Item.description: amount to clamp impulse to if character is contacting with one foot only and dynamicBalance is OK

Item.name: impulseOneLegApplyAbove
Item.description: if impulse is above this amount then do not scale/clamp just let it through as is - it's a shotgun or cannon

Item.name: impulseOneLegOn
Item.description: scale and/or clamp impulse if the character is contacting with one leg only and dynamicBalance is OK

Item.name: rbRatio
Item.description: 0.0 no rigidBody response, 0.5 half partForce half rigidBody, 1.0 = no partForce full rigidBody

Item.name: rbLowerShare
Item.description: rigid body response is shared between the upper and lower body (rbUpperShare = 1-rbLowerShare). rbLowerShare=0.5 gives upper and lower share scaled by mass. i.e. if 70% ub mass and 30% lower mass then rbLowerShare=0.5 gives actualrbShare of 0.7ub and 0.3lb. rbLowerShare GT 0.5 scales the ub share down from 0.7 and the lb up from 0.3.

Item.name: rbMoment
Item.description: 0.0 only force, 0.5 = force and half the rigid body moment applied, 1.0 = force and full rigidBody moment

Item.name: rbMaxTwistMomentArm
Item.description: Maximum twist arm moment of bullet applied

Item.name: rbMaxBroomMomentArm
Item.description: Maximum broom((everything but the twist) arm moment of bullet applied

Item.name: rbRatioAirborne
Item.description: if Airborne: 0.0 no rigidBody response, 0.5 half partForce half rigidBody, 1.0 = no partForce full rigidBody

Item.name: rbMomentAirborne
Item.description: if Airborne: 0.0 only force, 0.5 = force and half the rigid body moment applied, 1.0 = force and full rigidBody moment

Item.name: rbMaxTwistMomentArmAirborne
Item.description: if Airborne: Maximum twist arm moment of bullet applied

Item.name: rbMaxBroomMomentArmAirborne
Item.description: if Airborne: Maximum broom((everything but the twist) arm moment of bullet applied

Item.name: rbRatioOneLeg
Item.description: if only one leg in contact: 0.0 no rigidBody response, 0.5 half partForce half rigidBody, 1.0 = no partForce full rigidBody

Item.name: rbMomentOneLeg
Item.description: if only one leg in contact: 0.0 only force, 0.5 = force and half the rigid body moment applied, 1.0 = force and full rigidBody moment

Item.name: rbMaxTwistMomentArmOneLeg
Item.description: if only one leg in contact: Maximum twist arm moment of bullet applied

Item.name: rbMaxBroomMomentArmOneLeg
Item.description: if only one leg in contact: Maximum broom((everything but the twist) arm moment of bullet applied

Item.name: rbTwistAxis
Item.description: Twist axis 0=World Up, 1=CharacterCOM up

Item.name: rbPivot
Item.description: if false pivot around COM always, if true change pivot depending on foot contact: to feet centre if both feet in contact, or foot position if 1 foot in contact or COM position if no feet in contact

Item.name: configureBulletsExtra
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.description: spreads impulse across parts. currently only for spine parts, not limbs.

Item.description: if false pivot around COM always, if true change pivot depending on foot contact: to feet centre if both feet in contact, or foot position if 1 foot in contact or COM position if no feet in contact

Item.name: configureLimits
Item.description: configureLimits: Enable/disable/edit character limits in real time. This adjusts limits in RAGE-native space and will *not* reorient the joint.

Item.name: mask
Item.description: Two character body-masking value, bitwise joint mask or bitwise logic string of two character body-masking value for joint limits to configure. Ignored if index != -1.

Item.name: enable
Item.description: If false, disable (set all to PI, -PI) limits.

Item.name: toDesired
Item.description: If true, set limits to accommodate current desired angles

Item.name: restore
Item.description: Return to cached defaults?

Item.name: toCurAnimation
Item.description: If true, set limits to the current animated limits

Item.name: index
Item.description: Index of effector to configure. Set to -1 to use mask.

Item.name: lean1
Item.description: Custom limit values to use if not setting limits to desired. Limits are RAGE-native, not NM-wrapper-native.

Item.name: margin
Item.description: Joint limit margin to add to current animation limits when using those to set runtime limits.

Item.name: configureSoftLimit
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: index
Item.description: Select limb that the soft limit is going to be applied to

Item.name: stiffness
Item.description: Stiffness of the soft limit. Parameter is used to calculate spring term that contributes to the desired acceleration.

Item.name: damping
Item.description: Damping of the soft limit. Parameter is used to calculate damper term that contributes to the desired acceleration. To have the system critically dampened set it to 1.0.

Item.name: limitAngle
Item.description: Soft limit angle. Positive angle in RAD, measured relatively either from hard limit maxAngle (approach direction = -1) or minAngle (approach direction = 1). This angle will be clamped if outside the joint hard limit range.

Item.name: approachDirection
Item.description: Limit angle can be measured relatively to joints hard limit minAngle or maxAngle. Set approachDirection to +1 to measure soft limit angle relatively to hard limit minAngle that corresponds to the maximum stretch of the elbow. Set it to -1 to measure soft limit angle relatively to hard limit maxAngle that corresponds to the maximum stretch of the knee.

Item.name: velocityScaled
Item.description: Scale stiffness based on character angular velocity.

Item.name: configureShotInjuredArm
Item.description: configureShotInjuredArm: This single message allows you to configure the injured arm reaction during shot

Item.name: injuredArmTime
Item.description: length of the reaction

Item.name: hipYaw
Item.description: Amount of hip twist. (Negative values twist into bullet direction - probably not what is wanted)

Item.name: hipRoll
Item.description: Amount of hip roll

Item.name: forceStepExtraHeight
Item.description: Additional height added to stepping foot

Item.name: forceStep
Item.description: force a step to be taken whether pushed out of balance or not

Item.name: stepTurn
Item.description: turn the character using the balancer

Item.name: velMultiplierStart
Item.description: Start velocity where parameters begin to be ramped down to zero linearly

Item.name: velMultiplierEnd
Item.description: End velocity of ramp where parameters are scaled to zero

Item.name: velForceStep
Item.description: Velocity above which a step is not forced

Item.name: velStepTurn
Item.description: Velocity above which a stepTurn is not asked for

Item.name: velScales
Item.description: Use the velocity scaling parameters. Tune for standing still then use velocity scaling to make sure a running character stays balanced (the turning tends to make the character fall over more at speed)

Item.name: configureShotInjuredLeg
Item.description: configureShotInjuredLeg: This single message allows you to configure the injured leg reaction during shot

Item.name: timeBeforeCollapseWoundLeg
Item.description: time before a wounded leg is set to be weak and cause the character to collapse

Item.name: legInjuryTime
Item.description: Leg inury duration (reaction to being shot in leg)

Item.name: legForceStep
Item.description: force a step to be taken whether pushed out of balance or not

Item.name: legLimpBend
Item.description: Bend the legs via the balancer by this amount if stepping on the injured leg. 0.2 seems a good default

Item.name: legLiftTime
Item.description: Leg lift duration (reaction to being shot in leg) (lifting happens when not stepping with other leg)

Item.name: legInjury
Item.description: Leg injury - leg strength is reduced

Item.name: legInjuryHipPitch
Item.description: Leg injury bend forwards amount when not lifting leg

Item.name: legInjuryLiftHipPitch
Item.description: Leg injury bend forwards amount when lifting leg (lifting happens when not stepping with other leg)

Item.name: legInjurySpineBend
Item.description: Leg injury bend forwards amount when not lifting leg

Item.name: legInjuryLiftSpineBend
Item.description: Leg injury bend forwards amount when lifting leg (lifting happens when not stepping with other leg)

Item.name: setWeaponMode
Item.description: setWeaponMode: Use this message to set the character's weapon mode. This is an alternativeto the setWeaponMode public function.

Item.name: weaponMode
Item.description: Weapon mode. kNone = -1, kPistol = 0, kDual = 1, kRifle = 2, kSidearm = 3, kPistolLeft = 4, kPistolRight = 5. See WeaponMode enum in NmRsUtils.h and -1 from that.

Item.name: registerWeapon
Item.description: registerWeapon: Use this message to register weapon. This is an alternativeto the registerWeapon public function.

Item.name: hand
Item.description: What hand the weapon is in. LeftHand = 0, RightHand = 1

Item.name: levelIndex
Item.description: Level index of the weapon

Item.name: constraintHandle
Item.description: pointer to the hand-gun constraint handle

Item.name: gunToHandA
Item.description: A vector of the gunToHand matrix. The gunToHandMatrix is the desired gunToHandMatrix in the aimingPose. (The gunToHandMatrix when pointGun starts can be different so will be blended to this desired one)

Item.name: gunToHandB
Item.description: B vector of the gunToHand matrix

Item.name: gunToHandC
Item.description: C vector of the gunToHand matrix

Item.name: gunToHandD
Item.description: D vector of the gunToHand matrix

Item.name: gunToMuzzleInGun
Item.description: Gun centre to muzzle expressed in gun co-ordinates. To get the line of sight/barrel of the gun. Assumption: the muzzle direction is always along the same primary axis of the gun.

Item.name: gunToButtInGun
Item.description: Gun centre to butt expressed in gun co-ordinates. The gun pivots around this point when aiming

Item.name: shotRelax
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: relaxPeriodUpper
Item.description: time over which to relax to full relaxation for upper body

Item.name: relaxPeriodLower
Item.description: time over which to relax to full relaxation for lower body

Item.name: fireWeapon
Item.description: fireWeapon: One shot message apply a force to the hand as we fire the gun that should be in this hand

Item.name: firedWeaponStrength
Item.description: The force of the gun.

Item.name: gunHandEnum
Item.description: Which hand in the gun in, 0 = left, 1 = right.

Item.name: applyFireGunForceAtClavicle
Item.description: Should we apply some of the force at the shoulder. Force double handed weapons (Ak47 etc).

Item.name: inhibitTime
Item.description: Minimum time before next fire impulse

Item.name: direction
Item.description: direction of impulse in gun frame

Item.name: split
Item.description: Split force between hand and clavicle when applyFireGunForceAtClavicle is true. 1 = all hand, 0 = all clavicle.

Item.name: configureConstraints
Item.description: configureConstraints: One shot to give state of constraints on character and response to constraints

Item.name: handCuffsBehindBack
Item.description: not implemented

Item.name: legCuffs
Item.description: not implemented

Item.name: passiveMode
Item.description: 0 setCurrent, 1= IK to dominant, (2=pointGunLikeIK //not implemented)

Item.name: bespokeBehaviour
Item.description: not implemented

Item.name: blend2ZeroPose
Item.description: Blend Arms to zero pose

Item.name: stayUpright
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: useForces
Item.description: enable force based constraint

Item.name: useTorques
Item.description: enable torque based constraint

Item.name: lastStandMode
Item.description: Uses position/orientation control on the spine and drifts in the direction of bullets. This ignores all other stayUpright settings.

Item.name: lastStandSinkRate
Item.description: The sink rate (higher for a faster drop).

Item.name: lastStandHorizDamping
Item.description: Higher values for more damping

Item.name: lastStandMaxTime
Item.description: Max time allowed in last stand mode

Item.name: turnTowardsBullets
Item.description: Use cheat torques to face the direction of bullets if not facing too far away

Item.name: velocityBased
Item.description: make strength of constraint function of COM velocity. Uses -1 for forceDamping if the damping is positive.

Item.name: torqueOnlyInAir
Item.description: only apply torque based constraint when airBorne

Item.name: forceStrength
Item.description: strength of constraint

Item.name: forceDamping
Item.description: damping in constraint: -1 makes it scale automagically with forceStrength. Other negative values will scale this automagic damping.

Item.name: forceFeetMult
Item.description: multiplier to the force applied to the feet

Item.name: forceSpine3Share
Item.description: share of pelvis force applied to spine3

Item.name: forceLeanReduction
Item.description: how much the character lean is taken into account when reducing the force.

Item.name: forceInAirShare
Item.description: share of the feet force to the airborne foot

Item.name: forceMin
Item.description: when min and max are greater than 0 the constraint strength is determined from character strength, scaled into the range given by min and max

Item.name: forceMax
Item.description: see above

Item.name: forceSaturationVel
Item.description: when in velocityBased mode, the COM velocity at which constraint reaches maximum strength (forceStrength)

Item.name: forceThresholdVel
Item.description: when in velocityBased mode, the COM velocity above which constraint starts applying forces

Item.name: torqueStrength
Item.description: strength of torque based constraint

Item.name: torqueDamping
Item.description: damping of torque based constraint

Item.name: torqueSaturationVel
Item.description: when in velocityBased mode, the COM velocity at which constraint reaches maximum strength (torqueStrength)

Item.name: torqueThresholdVel
Item.description: when in velocityBased mode, the COM velocity above which constraint starts applying torques

Item.name: supportPosition
Item.description: distance the foot is behind Com projection that is still considered able to generate the support for the upright constraint

Item.name: noSupportForceMult
Item.description: still apply this fraction of the upright constaint force if the foot is not in a position (defined by supportPosition) to generate the support for the upright constraint

Item.name: stepUpHelp
Item.description: strength of cheat force applied upwards to spine3 to help the character up steps/slopes

Item.name: stayUpAcc
Item.description: How much the cheat force takes into account the acceleration of moving platforms

Item.name: stayUpAccMax
Item.description: The maximum floorAcceleration (of a moving platform) that the cheat force takes into account

Item.name: stopAllBehaviours
Item.description: stopAllBehaviours: Send this message to immediately stop all behaviours from executing.

Item.name: setCharacterStrength
Item.description: setCharacterStrength: Sets character's strength on the dead-granny-to-healthy-terminator scale: [0..1]

Item.name: characterStrength
Item.description: strength of character

Item.name: setCharacterHealth
Item.description: setCharacterHealth: Sets character's health on the dead-to-alive scale: [0..1]

Item.name: characterHealth
Item.description: health of character

Item.name: setFallingReaction
Item.description: setFallingReaction: Sets the type of reaction if catchFall is called

Item.name: handsAndKnees
Item.description: set to true to get handsAndKnees catchFall if catchFall called. If true allows the dynBalancer to stay on during the catchfall and modifies the catch fall to give a more alive looking performance (hands and knees for front landing or sitting up for back landing)

Item.name: callRDS
Item.description: If true catchFall will call rollDownstairs if comVel GT comVelRDSThresh - prevents excessive sliding in catchFall. Was previously only true for handsAndKnees

Item.name: comVelRDSThresh
Item.description: comVel above which rollDownstairs will start - prevents excessive sliding in catchFall

Item.name: resistRolling
Item.description: For rds catchFall only: True to resist rolling motion (rolling motion is set off by ub contact and a sliding velocity), false to allow more of a continuous rolling (rolling motion is set off at a sliding velocity)

Item.name: armReduceSpeed
Item.description: Strength is reduced in the catchFall when the arms contact the ground. 0.2 is good for handsAndKnees. 2.5 is good for normal catchFall, anything lower than 1.0 for normal catchFall may lead to bad catchFall poses.

Item.name: reachLengthMultiplier
Item.description: Reach length multiplier that scales characters arm topological length, value in range from (0, 1 GT where 1.0 means reach length is maximum.

Item.name: inhibitRollingTime
Item.description: Time after hitting ground that the catchFall can call rds

Item.name: changeFrictionTime
Item.description: Time after hitting ground that the catchFall can change the friction of parts to inhibit sliding

Item.name: groundFriction
Item.description: 8.0 was used on yanked) Friction multiplier on bodyParts when on ground. Character can look too slidy with groundFriction = 1. Higher values give a more jerky reation but this seems timestep dependent especially for dragged by the feet.

Item.name: frictionMin
Item.description: Min Friction of an impact with a body part (not head, hands or feet) - to increase friction of slippy environment to get character to roll better. Applied in catchFall and rollUp(rollDownStairs)

Item.name: frictionMax
Item.description: Max Friction of an impact with a body part (not head, hands or feet) - to increase friction of slippy environment to get character to roll better. Applied in catchFall and rollUp(rollDownStairs)

Item.name: stopOnSlopes
Item.description: Apply tactics to help stop on slopes.

Item.name: stopManual
Item.description: Override slope value to manually force stopping on flat ground. Encourages character to come to rest face down or face up.

Item.name: stoppedStrengthDecay
Item.description: Speed at which strength reduces when stopped.

Item.name: spineLean1Offset
Item.description: Bias spine post towards hunched (away from arched).

Item.name: riflePose
Item.description: Hold rifle in a safe position to reduce complications with collision. Only applied if holding a rifle

Item.name: hkHeadAvoid
Item.description: Enable head ground avoidance when handsAndKnees is true.

Item.name: antiPropClav
Item.description: Discourage the character getting stuck propped up by elbows when falling backwards - by inhibiting backwards moving clavicles (keeps the arms slightly wider)

Item.name: antiPropWeak
Item.description: Discourage the character getting stuck propped up by elbows when falling backwards - by weakening the arms as soon they hit the floor. (Also stops the hands lifting up when flat on back)

Item.name: headAsWeakAsArms
Item.description: Head weakens as arms weaken. If false and antiPropWeak when falls onto back doesn't loosen neck so early (matches bodyStrength instead)

Item.name: successStrength
Item.description: When bodyStrength is less than successStrength send a success feedback - DO NOT GO OUTSIDE MIN/MAX PARAMETER VALUES OTHERWISE NO SUCCESS FEEDBACK WILL BE SENT

Item.name: setCharacterUnderwater
Item.description: setCharacterUnderwater: Sets viscosity applied to damping limbs

Item.name: underwater
Item.description: is character underwater?

Item.name: viscosity
Item.description: viscosity applied to character's parts

Item.name: gravityFactor
Item.description: gravity factor applied to character

Item.name: stroke
Item.description: swimming force applied to character as a function of handVelocity and footVelocity

Item.name: linearStroke
Item.description: swimming force (linearStroke=true,False) = (f(v),f(v*v))

Item.name: setCharacterCollisions
Item.description: setCharacterCollisions:

Item.name: spin
Item.description: sliding friction turned into spin 80.0 (used in demo videos) good for rest of default params below. If 0.0 then no collision enhancement

Item.name: maxVelocity
Item.description: torque = spin*(relative velocity) up to this maximum for relative velocity

Item.name: footSlip
Item.description: allow foot slipping if collided

Item.name: vehicleClass
Item.description: ClassType of the object against which to enhance the collision. All character vehicle interaction (e.g. braceForImpact glancing spins) relies on this value so EDIT WISELY. If it is used for things other than vehicles then NM should be informed.

Item.name: setCharacterDamping
Item.description: setCharacterDamping: Damp out cartwheeling and somersaulting above a certain threshold

Item.name: somersaultThresh
Item.description: Somersault AngularMomentum measure above which we start damping - try 34.0. Falling over straight backwards gives 54 on hitting ground.

Item.name: somersaultDamp
Item.description: Amount to damp somersaulting by (spinning around left/right axis) - try 0.45

Item.name: cartwheelThresh
Item.description: Cartwheel AngularMomentum measure above which we start damping - try 27.0

Item.name: cartwheelDamp
Item.description: Amount to damp somersaulting by (spinning around front/back axis) - try 0.8

Item.name: vehicleCollisionTime
Item.description: Time after impact with a vehicle to apply characterDamping. -ve values mean always apply whether collided with vehicle or not. =0.0 never apply. =timestep apply for only that frame. A typical roll from being hit by a car lasts about 4secs.

Item.name: v2
Item.description: If true damping is proportional to Angular momentum squared. If false proportional to Angular momentum

Item.name: setFrictionScale
Item.description: setFrictionScale:

Item.name: scale
Item.description: Friction scale to be applied to parts in mask.

Item.name: globalMin
Item.description: Character-wide minimum impact friction. Affects all parts (not just those in mask).

Item.name: globalMax
Item.description: Character-wide maximum impact friction. Affects all parts (not just those in mask).

Item.name: mask
Item.description: Two character body-masking value, bitwise joint mask or bitwise logic string of two character body-masking value (see Active Pose notes for possible values)

Item.name: animPose
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: muscleStiffness
Item.description: muscleStiffness of masked joints. -values mean don't apply (just use defaults or ones applied by behaviours - safer if you are going to return to a behaviour)

Item.name: stiffness
Item.description: stiffness of masked joints. -ve values mean don't apply stiffness or damping (just use defaults or ones applied by behaviours). If you are using animpose fullbody on its own then this gives the opprtunity to use setStffness and setMuscle messages to set up the character's muscles. mmmmtodo get rid of this -ve

Item.name: damping
Item.description: damping of masked joints

Item.name: effectorMask
Item.description: Two character body-masking value, bitwise joint mask or bitwise logic string of two character body-masking value (see notes for explanation)

Item.name: overideHeadlook
Item.description: overide Headlook behaviour (if animPose includes the head)

Item.name: overidePointArm
Item.description: overide PointArm behaviour (if animPose includes the arm/arms)

Item.name: overidePointGun
Item.description: overide PointGun behaviour (if animPose includes the arm/arms)//mmmmtodo not used at moment

Item.name: useZMPGravityCompensation
Item.description: If true then modify gravity compensation based on stance (can reduce gravity compensation to zero if cofm is outside of balance area)

Item.name: gravityCompensation
Item.description: gravity compensation applied to joints in the effectorMask. If -ve then not applied (use current setting)

Item.name: muscleLeftArm
Item.description: muscle stiffness applied to left arm (applied after stiffness). If -ve then not applied (use current setting)

Item.name: muscleStiffnessRightArm
Item.description: muscle stiffness applied to right arm (applied after stiffness). If -ve then not applied (use current setting)

Item.name: muscleStiffnessSpine
Item.description: muscle stiffness applied to spine (applied after stiffness). If -ve then not applied (use current setting)

Item.name: muscleStiffnessLeftLeg
Item.description: muscle stiffness applied to left leg (applied after stiffness). If -ve then not applied (use current setting)

Item.name: muscleStiffnessRightLeg
Item.description: muscle stiffness applied to right leg (applied after stiffness). If -ve then not applied (use current setting)

Item.name: stiffnessLeftArm
Item.description: stiffness applied to left arm (applied after stiffness). If -ve then not applied (use current setting)

Item.name: stiffnessRightArm
Item.description: stiffness applied to right arm (applied after stiffness). If -ve then not applied (use current setting)

Item.name: stiffnessSpine
Item.description: stiffness applied to spine (applied after stiffness). If -ve then not applied (use current setting)

Item.name: stiffnessLeftLeg
Item.description: stiffness applied to left leg (applied after stiffness). If -ve then not applied (use current setting)

Item.name: stiffnessRightLeg
Item.description: stiffness applied to right leg (applied after stiffness). If -ve then not applied (use current setting)

Item.name: dampingLeftArm
Item.description: damping applied to left arm (applied after stiffness). If stiffness -ve then not applied (use current setting)

Item.name: dampingRightArm
Item.description: damping applied to right arm (applied after stiffness). If stiffness -ve then not applied (use current setting)

Item.name: dampingSpine
Item.description: damping applied to spine (applied after stiffness). If stiffness-ve then not applied (use current setting)

Item.name: dampingLeftLeg
Item.description: damping applied to left leg (applied after stiffness). If stiffness-ve then not applied (use current setting)

Item.name: dampingRightLeg
Item.description: damping applied to right leg (applied after stiffness). If stiffness -ve then not applied (use current setting)

Item.name: gravCompLeftArm
Item.description: gravity compensation applied to left arm (applied after gravityCompensation). If -ve then not applied (use current setting)

Item.name: gravCompRightArm
Item.description: gravity compensation applied to right arm (applied after gravityCompensation). If -ve then not applied (use current setting)

Item.name: gravCompSpine
Item.description: gravity compensation applied to spine (applied after gravityCompensation). If -ve then not applied (use current setting)

Item.name: gravCompLeftLeg
Item.description: gravity compensation applied to left leg (applied after gravityCompensation). If -ve then not applied (use current setting)

Item.name: gravCompRightLeg
Item.description: gravity compensation applied to right leg (applied after gravityCompensation). If -ve then not applied (use current setting)

Item.name: connectedLeftHand
Item.description: Is the left hand constrained to the world/ an object: -1=auto decide by impact info, 0=no, 1=part fully constrained (not implemented:, 2=part point constraint, 3=line constraint)

Item.name: connectedRightHand
Item.description: Is the right hand constrained to the world/ an object: -1=auto decide by impact info, 0=no, 1=part fully constrained (not implemented:, 2=part point constraint, 3=line constraint)

Item.name: connectedLeftFoot
Item.description: Is the left foot constrained to the world/ an object: -2=do not set in animpose (e.g. let the balancer decide), -1=auto decide by impact info, 0=no, 1=part fully constrained (not implemented:, 2=part point constraint, 3=line constraint)

Item.name: connectedRightFoot
Item.description: Is the right foot constrained to the world/ an object: -2=do not set in animpose (e.g. let the balancer decide),-1=auto decide by impact info, 0=no, 1=part fully constrained (not implemented:, 2=part point constraint, 3=line constraint)

Item.name: animSource
Item.description: AnimSource 0 = CurrentItms, 1 = PreviousItms, 2 = AnimItms

Item.name: dampenSideMotionInstanceIndex

Item.description: Steps are ihibited to not go closer to the wall than this (after impact).

Item.name: footFrictionMultRate
Item.description: Friction multiplier reduced by this amount every second after slump starts (only if character is not slumping)

Item.name: backFrictionMultStart

Item.name: backFrictionMultRate
Item.description: Friction multiplier reduced by this amount every second after slump starts (only if character is not slumping)

Item.description: Reduce the stiffness of the legs by this much as soon as an impact is detected

Item.name: slumpLegStiffReduction
Item.description: Reduce the stiffness of the legs by this much as soon as slump starts

Item.name: slumpLegStiffRate
Item.description: Rate at which the stiffness of the legs is reduced during slump

Item.name: reactTime
Item.description: Time that the character reacts to the impact with ub flinch and writhe

Item.name: impactExagTime
Item.description: Time that the character exaggerates impact with spine

Item.name: glanceSpinDecayMult

Item.name: ignoreColWithIndex
Item.description: used so impact with the character that is pushing you over doesn't set off the behaviour

Item.name: slumpMode
Item.description: 0=Normal slump(less movement then slump and movement LT small), 1=fast slump, 2=less movement then slump

Item.name: reboundMode
Item.description: 0=fall2knees/slump if shot not running, 1=stumble, 2=slump, 3=restart

Item.name: ignoreColMassBelow
Item.description: collisions with non-fixed objects with mass below this will not set this behaviour off (e.g. ignore guns)

Item.name: forwardMode
Item.description: 0=slump, 1=fallToKnees if shot is running, otherwise slump

Item.name: timeToForward
Item.description: time after a forwards impact before forwardMode is called (leave sometime for a rebound or brace - the min of 0.1 is to ensure fallOverWall can start although it probably needs only 1or2 frames for the probes to return)

Item.name: reboundForce
Item.description: if forwards impact only: cheat force to try to get the character away from the wall. 3 is a good value.

Item.name: braceWall
Item.description: Brace against wall if forwards impact(at the moment only if bodyBalance is running/in charge of arms)

Item.name: ignoreColVolumeBelow
Item.description: collisions with non-fixed objects with volume below this will not set this behaviour off

Item.name: fallOverWallDrape
Item.description: use fallOverWall as the main drape reaction

Item.name: fallOverHighWalls
Item.description: trigger fall over wall if hit up to spine2 else only if hit up to spine1

Item.name: snapDirectionRandomness
Item.description: The character snaps in a prescribed way (decided by bullet direction) - Higher the value the more random this direction is.

Item.name: snapUseTorques

Item.name: impactWeaknessZeroDuration

Item.name: impactWeaknessRampDuration
Item.description: duration of the ramp to bring the character's upper body stiffness back to normal levels

Item.name: impactLoosenessAmount

Item.name: shoulder
Item.description: How much the shoulder(lean1) swings based on the leg movement

Item.name: armDamping
Item.description: NB. WAS m_damping NeckDamping=1 ClaviclesDamping=1

Item.name: useHeadLook
Item.description: enable and provide a look-at target to make the character's head turn to face it while balancing

Item.name: headLookPos
Item.description: position of thing to look at

Item.name: headLookInstanceIndex
Item.description: level index of thing to look at

Item.name: somersaultAngle
Item.description: multiplier of the somersault 'angle' (lean forward/back) for arms out (lean2)

Item.name: somersaultAngleThreshold
Item.description: Amount of somersault 'angle' before m_somersaultAngle is used for ArmsOut. Unless drunk - DO NOT EXCEED 0.8

Item.name: sideSomersaultAngle
Item.description: Amount of side somersault 'angle' before sideSomersault is used for ArmsOut. Unless drunk - DO NOT EXCEED 0.8

Item.name: backwardsAutoTurn
Item.description: Automatically turn around if moving backwards

Item.name: turnWithBumpRadius
Item.description: 0.9 is a sensible value. If pusher within this distance then turn to get out of the way of the pusher

Item.name: backwardsArms
Item.description: Bend elbows, relax shoulders and inhibit spine twist when moving backwards

Item.name: blendToZeroPose
Item.description: Blend upper body to zero pose as the character comes to rest. If false blend to a stored pose

Item.name: armsOutOnPush
Item.description: Put arms out based on lean2 of legs, or angular velocity (lean or twist), or lean (front/back or side/side)

Item.name: armsOutOnPushMultiplier
Item.description: Arms out based on lean2 of the legs to simulate being pushed

Item.name: armsOutOnPushTimeout
Item.description: number of seconds before turning off the armsOutOnPush response only for Arms out based on lean2 of the legs (NOT for the angle or angular velocity)

Item.name: returningToBalanceArmsOut
Item.description: range 0:1 0 = don't raise arms if returning to upright position, 0.x = 0.x*raise arms based on angvel and 'angle' settings, 1 = raise arms based on angvel and 'angle' settings

Item.name: armsOutStraightenElbows
Item.description: multiplier for straightening the elbows based on the amount of arms out(lean2) 0 = dont straighten elbows. Otherwise straighten elbows proportionately to armsOut

Item.name: armsOutMinLean2
Item.description: Minimum desiredLean2 applied to shoulder (to stop arms going above shoulder height or not)

Item.name: elbowAngleOnContact
Item.description: on contact with upperbody the desired elbow angle is set to at least this value

Item.name: bendElbowsTime
Item.description: Time after contact (with Upper body) that the min m_elbowAngleOnContact is applied

Item.name: bendElbowsGait
Item.description: Minimum desired angle of elbow during non contact arm swing

Item.name: hipL2ArmL2
Item.description: mmmmdrunk = 0.2 multiplier of hip lean2 (star jump) to give shoulder lean2 (flapping)

Item.name: shoulderL2
Item.description: mmmmdrunk = 0.7 shoulder lean2 offset

Item.name: shoulderL1
Item.description: mmmmdrunk 1.1 shoulder lean1 offset (+ve frankenstein)

Item.name: shoulderTwist
Item.description: mmmmdrunk = 0.0 shoulder twist

Item.name: headLookAtVelProb
Item.description: Probability [0-1] that headLook will be looking in the direction of velocity when stepping

Item.name: turnOffProb
Item.description: Weighted Probability that turn will be off. This is one of six turn type weights.

Item.name: turn2VelProb
Item.description: Weighted Probability of turning towards velocity. This is one of six turn type weights.

Item.name: turnAwayProb
Item.description: Weighted Probability of turning away from headLook target. This is one of six turn type weights.

Item.name: turnLeftProb
Item.description: Weighted Probability of turning left. This is one of six turn type weights.

Item.name: turnRightProb
Item.description: Weighted Probability of turning right. This is one of six turn type weights.

Item.name: turn2TargetProb
Item.description: Weighted Probability of turning towards headLook target. This is one of six turn type weights.

Item.name: angVelMultiplier
Item.description: somersault, twist, sideSomersault) multiplier of the angular velocity for arms out (lean2) (somersault, twist, sideSomersault)

Item.name: angVelThreshold
Item.description: somersault, twist, sideSomersault) threshold above which angVel is used for arms out (lean2) Unless drunk - DO NOT EXCEED 7.0 for each component

Item.name: braceDistance
Item.description: if -ve then do not brace. distance from object at which to raise hands to brace 0.5 good if newBrace=true - otherwise 0.65

Item.name: targetPredictionTime
Item.description: time expected to get arms up from idle

Item.name: reachAbsorbtionTime
Item.description: larger values and he absorbs the impact more

Item.name: braceStiffness
Item.description: stiffness of character. catch_fall stiffness scales with this too, with its defaults at this values default

Item.name: minBraceTime
Item.description: minimum bracing time so the character doesn't look twitchy

Item.name: timeToBackwardsBrace
Item.description: time before arm brace kicks in when hit from behind

Item.name: handsDelayMin
Item.description: If bracing with 2 hands delay one hand by at least this amount of time to introduce some asymmetry.

Item.name: handsDelayMax
Item.description: If bracing with 2 hands delay one hand by at most this amount of time to introduce some asymmetry.

Item.name: braceOffset
Item.description: braceTarget is global headLookPos plus braceOffset m in the up direction

Item.name: moveRadius
Item.description: if -ve don't move away from pusher unless moveWhenBracing is true and braceDistance GT 0.0f. if the pusher is closer than moveRadius then move away from it.

Item.name: moveAmount
Item.description: amount of leanForce applied away from pusher

Item.name: moveWhenBracing
Item.description: Only move away from pusher when bracing against pusher

Item.description: The stiffness of the body determines how fast the character moves into the position, and how well that they hold it.

Item.description: Sets damping value for the character joints

Item.name: asymmetry
Item.description: A value between 0-1 that controls how asymmetric the results are by varying stiffness across the body

Item.name: randomSeed
Item.description: Random seed used to generate asymmetry values

Item.name: backTwist
Item.description: Amount of random back twist to add

Item.name: mask
Item.description: Two character body-masking value, bitwise joint mask or bitwise logic string of two character body-masking value (see Active Pose notes for possible values)

Item.name: bodyRollUp
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: stiffness
Item.description: stiffness of whole body

Item.name: useArmToSlowDown
Item.description: the degree to which the character will try to stop a barrel roll with his arms

Item.name: armReachAmount
Item.description: the likeliness of the character reaching for the ground with its arms

Item.name: mask
Item.description: Two character body-masking value, bitwise joint mask or bitwise logic string of two character body-masking value (see Active Pose notes for possible values)

Item.name: legPush
Item.description: used to keep rolling down slope, 1 is full (kicks legs out when pointing upwards)

Item.name: asymmetricalLegs
Item.description: 0 is no leg asymmetry in 'foetal' position. greater than 0 a asymmetricalLegs-rand(30%), added/minus each joint of the legs in radians. Random number changes about once every roll. 0.4 gives a lot of asymmetry

Item.name: noRollTimeBeforeSuccess
Item.description: time that roll velocity has to be lower than rollVelForSuccess, before success message is sent

Item.name: rollVelForSuccess
Item.description: lower threshold for roll velocity at which success message can be sent

Item.name: rollVelLinearContribution
Item.description: contribution of linear COM velocity to roll Velocity (if 0, roll velocity equal to COM angular velocity)

Item.name: velocityScale
Item.description: Scales perceived body velocity. The higher this value gets, the more quickly the velocity measure saturates, resulting in a tighter roll at slower speeds. (NB: Set to 1 to match earlier behaviour)

Item.name: velocityOffset
Item.description: Offsets perceived body velocity. Increase to create larger "dead zone" around zero velocity where character will be less rolled. (NB: Reset to 0 to match earlier behaviour)

Item.name: applyMinMaxFriction
Item.description: Controls whether or not behaviour enforces min/max friction

Item.name: bodyWrithe
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: legStiffness
Item.description: The stiffness of the character will determine how 'determined' a writhe this is - high values will make him thrash about wildly

Item.name: armDamping
Item.description: damping amount, less is underdamped

Item.name: backDamping
Item.description: damping amount, less is underdamped

Item.name: legDamping
Item.description: damping amount, less is underdamped

Item.name: armPeriod
Item.description: Controls how fast the writhe is executed, smaller values make faster motions

Item.name: backPeriod
Item.description: Controls how fast the writhe is executed, smaller values make faster motions

Item.name: legPeriod
Item.description: Controls how fast the writhe is executed, smaller values make faster motions

Item.name: mask
Item.description: Two character body-masking value, bitwise joint mask or bitwise logic string of two character body-masking value (see Active Pose notes for possible values)

Item.name: backAmplitude
Item.description: scales the amount of writhe. 0 = no writhe

Item.name: legAmplitude
Item.description: scales the amount of writhe. 0 = no writhe

Item.name: rollOverFlag
Item.description: Flag to set trying to rollOver

Item.name: blendArms
Item.description: Blend the writhe arms with the current desired arms (0=don't apply any writhe, 1=only writhe)

Item.name: blendBack
Item.description: Blend the writhe spine and neck with the current desired (0=don't apply any writhe, 1=only writhe)

Item.name: blendLegs
Item.description: Blend the writhe legs with the current desired legs (0=don't apply any writhe, 1=only writhe)

Item.name: applyStiffness
Item.description: Use writhe stiffnesses if true. If false don't set any stiffnesses

Item.name: onFire
Item.description: Extra shoulderBlend. Rolling:one way only, maxRollOverTime, rollOverRadius, doesn't reduce arm stiffness to help rolling. No shoulder twist

Item.name: shoulderLean1
Item.description: Blend writhe shoulder desired lean1 with this angle in RAD. Note that onFire has to be set to true for this parameter to take any effect.

Item.name: shoulderLean2
Item.description: Blend writhe shoulder desired lean2 with this angle in RAD. Note that onFire has to be set to true for this parameter to take any effect.

Item.name: lean1BlendFactor
Item.description: Shoulder desired lean1 with shoulderLean1 angle blend factor. Set it to 0 to use original shoulder withe desired lean1 angle for shoulders. Note that onFire has to be set to true for this parameter to take any effect.

Item.name: lean2BlendFactor
Item.description: Shoulder desired lean2 with shoulderLean2 angle blend factor. Set it to 0 to use original shoulder withe desired lean2 angle for shoulders. Note that onFire has to be set to true for this parameter to take any effect.

Item.name: rollTorqueScale
Item.description: Scale rolling torque that is applied to character spine.

Item.name: maxRollOverTime
Item.description: Rolling torque is ramped down over time. At this time in seconds torque value converges to zero. Use this parameter to restrict time the character is rolling. Note that onFire has to be set to true for this parameter to take any effect.

Item.name: rollOverRadius
Item.description: Rolling torque is ramped down with distance measured from position where character hit the ground and started rolling. At this distance in meters torque value converges to zero. Use this parameter to restrict distance the character travels due to rolling. Note that onFire has to be set to true for this parameter to take any effect.

Item.name: braceForImpact
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: braceDistance
Item.description: distance from object at which to raise hands to brace 0.5 good if newBrace=true - otherwise 0.65

Item.name: targetPredictionTime
Item.description: time epected to get arms up from idle

Item.name: reachAbsorbtionTime
Item.description: larger values and he absorbs the impact more

Item.name: instanceIndex
Item.description: levelIndex of object to brace

Item.name: bodyStiffness
Item.description: stiffness of character. catch_fall stiffness scales with this too, with its defaults at this values default

Item.name: grabDontLetGo
Item.description: Once a constraint is made, keep reaching with whatever hand is allowed

Item.name: grabStrength
Item.description: strength in hands for grabbing (kg m/s), -1 to ignore/disable

Item.name: grabDistance
Item.description: Relative distance at which the grab starts.

Item.name: grabReachAngle
Item.description: Angle from front at which the grab activates. If the point is outside this angle from front will not try to grab.

Item.name: grabHoldTimer
Item.description: amount of time, in seconds, before grab automatically bails

Item.name: justBrace
Item.description: Flag to toggle between grabbing and bracing

Item.name: maxGrabCarVelocity
Item.description: Don't try to grab a car moving above this speed mmmmtodo make this the relative velocity of car to character?

Item.name: timeToBackwardsBrace
Item.description: time before arm brace kicks in when hit from behind

Item.name: look
Item.description: position to look at, e.g. the driver

Item.name: pos
Item.description: location of the front part of the object to brace against. This should be the centre of where his hands should meet the object

Item.name: minBraceTime
Item.description: minimum bracing time so the character doesn't look twitchy

Item.name: handsDelayMin
Item.description: If bracing with 2 hands delay one hand by at least this amount of time to introduce some asymmetry.

Item.name: handsDelayMax
Item.description: If bracing with 2 hands delay one hand by at most this amount of time to introduce some asymmetry.

Item.name: moveAway
Item.description: move away from the car (if in reaching zone)

Item.name: moveAwayAmount
Item.description: forceLean away amount (-ve is lean towards)

Item.name: moveAwayLean
Item.description: Lean away amount (-ve is lean towards)

Item.name: moveSideways
Item.description: Amount of sideways movement if at the front or back of the car to add to the move away from car

Item.name: bbArms
Item.description: Use bodyBalance arms for the default (non bracing) behaviour if bodyBalance is active

Item.name: newBrace
Item.description: Use the new brace prediction code

Item.name: braceOnImpact
Item.description: If true then if a shin or thigh is in contact with the car then brace. NB: newBrace must be true. For those situations where the car has pushed the ped backwards (at the same speed as the car) before the behaviour has been started and so doesn't predict an impact.

Item.name: roll2Velocity
Item.description: When rollDownStairs is running use roll2Velocity to control the helper torques (this only attempts to roll to the chaarcter's velocity not some default linear velocity mag

Item.name: rollType
Item.description: 0 = original/roll off/stay on car: Roll with character velocity, 1 = //Gentle: roll off/stay on car = use relative velocity of character to car to roll against, 2 = //roll over car: Roll against character velocity. i.e. roll against any velocity picked up by hitting car, 3 = //Gentle: roll over car: use relative velocity of character to car to roll with

Item.name: snapImpacts
Item.description: Exaggerate impacts using snap

Item.name: snapImpact
Item.description: Exaggeration amount of the initial impact (legs). +ve fold with car impact (as if pushed at hips in the car velocity direction). -ve fold away from car impact

Item.name: snapBonnet
Item.description: Exaggeration amount of the secondary (torso) impact with bonnet. +ve fold with car impact (as if pushed at hips by the impact normal). -ve fold away from car impact

Item.name: snapFloor
Item.description: Exaggeration amount of the impact with the floor after falling off of car +ve fold with floor impact (as if pushed at hips in the impact normal direction). -ve fold away from car impact

Item.name: dampVel
Item.description: Damp out excessive spin and upward velocity when on car

Item.name: dampSpin
Item.description: Amount to damp spinning by (cartwheeling and somersaulting)

Item.name: dampUpVel
Item.description: Amount to damp upward velocity by to limit the amount of air above the car the character can get.

Item.name: dampSpinThresh
Item.description: Angular velocity above which we start damping

Item.name: dampUpVelThresh
Item.description: Upward velocity above which we start damping

Item.name: gsHelp
Item.description: Enhance a glancing spin with the side of the car by modulating body friction.

Item.name: gsEndMin
Item.description: ID for glancing spin. min depth to be considered from either end (front/rear) of a car (-ve is inside the car area)

Item.name: gsSideMin
Item.description: ID for glancing spin. min depth to be considered on the side of a car (-ve is inside the car area)

Item.name: gsSideMax
Item.description: ID for glancing spin. max depth to be considered on the side of a car (+ve is outside the car area)

Item.name: gsUpness
Item.description: ID for glancing spin. Character has to be more upright than this value for it to be considered on the side of a car. Fully upright = 1, upsideDown = -1. Max Angle from upright is acos(gsUpness)

Item.name: gsCarVelMin
Item.description: ID for glancing spin. Minimum car velocity.

Item.name: gsScale1Foot
Item.description: Apply gsFricScale1 to the foot if colliding with car. (Otherwise foot friction - with the ground - is determined by gsFricScale2 if it is in gsFricMask2)

Item.name: gsFricScale1
Item.description: Glancing spin help. Friction scale applied when to the side of the car. e.g. make the character spin more by upping the friction against the car

Item.name: gsFricMask1
Item.description: Glancing spin help. Two character body-masking value, bitwise joint mask or bitwise logic string of two character body-masking value (see notes for explanation). Note gsFricMask1 and gsFricMask2 are made independent by the code so you can have fb for gsFricMask1 but gsFricScale1 will not be applied to any bodyParts in gsFricMask2

Item.name: gsFricScale2
Item.description: Glancing spin help. Friction scale applied when to the side of the car. e.g. make the character spin more by lowering the feet friction. You could also lower the wrist friction here to stop the car pulling along the hands i.e. gsFricMask2 = la|uw

Item.name: gsFricMask2
Item.description: Two character body-masking value, bitwise joint mask or bitwise logic string of two character body-masking value (see notes for explanation). Note gsFricMask1 and gsFricMask2 are made independent by the code so you can have fb for gsFricMask1 but gsFricScale1 will not be applied to any bodyParts in gsFricMask2

Item.name: buoyancy
Item.description: buoyancy: Simple buoyancy model. No character movement just fluid forces/torques added to parts.

Item.name: surfacePoint
Item.description: Arbitrary point on surface of water.

Item.name: surfaceNormal
Item.description: Normal to surface of water.

Item.name: buoyancy
Item.description: Buoyancy multiplier.

Item.name: chestBuoyancy
Item.description: Buoyancy mulplier for spine2/3. Helps character float upright.

Item.name: damping
Item.description: Damping for submerged parts.

Item.name: righting
Item.description: Use righting torque to being character face-up in water?

Item.name: rightingStrength
Item.description: Strength of righting torque.

Item.name: rightingTime
Item.description: How long to wait after chest hits water to begin righting torque.

Item.name: catchFall
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: torsoStiffness
Item.description: stiffness of torso

Item.name: legsStiffness
Item.description: stiffness of legs

Item.name: armsStiffness
Item.description: stiffness of arms

Item.name: backwardsMinArmOffset
Item.description: 0 will prop arms up near his shoulders. -0.3 will place hands nearer his behind

Item.name: forwardMaxArmOffset
Item.description: 0 will point arms down with angled body, 0.45 will point arms forward a bit to catch nearer the head

Item.name: zAxisSpinReduction
Item.description: Tries to reduce the spin around the Z axis. Scale 0 - 1.

Item.name: extraSit
Item.description: Scale extra-sit value 0..1. Setting to 0 helps with arched-back issues. Set to 1 for a more alive-looking finish.

Item.name: useHeadLook
Item.description: Toggle to use the head look in this behaviour.

Item.name: mask
Item.description: Two character body-masking value, bitwise joint mask or bitwise logic string of two character body-masking value (see Active Pose notes for possible values)

Item.name: electrocute
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: stunMag
Item.description: The magnitude of the reaction

Item.name: initialMult
Item.description: initialMult*stunMag = The magnitude of the 1st snap reaction (other mults are applied after this)

Item.name: largeMult
Item.description: largeMult*stunMag = The magnitude of a random large snap reaction (other mults are applied after this)

Item.name: largeMinTime
Item.description: min time to next large random snap (about 14 snaps with stunInterval = 0.07s)

Item.name: largeMaxTime
Item.description: max time to next large random snap (about 28 snaps with stunInterval = 0.07s)

Item.name: movingMult
Item.description: movingMult*stunMag = The magnitude of the reaction if moving(comVelMag) faster than movingThresh

Item.name: balancingMult
Item.description: balancingMult*stunMag = The magnitude of the reaction if balancing = (not lying on the floor/ not upper body not collided) and not airborne

Item.name: airborneMult
Item.description: airborneMult*stunMag = The magnitude of the reaction if airborne

Item.name: movingThresh
Item.description: If moving(comVelMag) faster than movingThresh then mvingMult applied to stunMag

Item.name: stunInterval
Item.description: Direction flips every stunInterval

Item.name: directionRandomness
Item.description: The character vibrates in a prescribed way - Higher the value the more random this direction is.

Item.name: leftArm
Item.description: vibrate the leftArm.

Item.name: rightArm
Item.description: vibrate the rightArm.

Item.name: leftLeg
Item.description: vibrate the leftLeg.

Item.name: rightLeg
Item.description: vibrate the rightLeg.

Item.name: spine
Item.description: vibrate the spine.

Item.name: neck
Item.description: vibrate the neck.

Item.name: phasedLegs
Item.description: Legs are either in phase with each other or not

Item.name: applyStiffness
Item.description: let electrocute apply a (higher generally) stiffness to the character whilst being vibrated

Item.name: useTorques
Item.description: use torques to make vibration otherwise use a change in the parts angular velocity

Item.name: hipType
Item.description: type of hip reaction 0=none, 1=side2side 2=steplike

Item.name: fallOverWall
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: bodyStiffness
Item.description: stiffness of the body, roll up stiffness scales with this and defaults at this default value

Item.name: damping
Item.description: Damping in the effectors

Item.name: magOfForce
Item.description: Magnitude of the falloverWall helper force

Item.name: maxDistanceFromPelToHitPoint
Item.description: The maximum distance away from the pelvis that hit points will be registered.

Item.name: maxForceDist
Item.description: maximum distance between hitPoint and body part at which forces are applied to part

Item.name: stepExclusionZone
Item.description: Specifies extent of area in front of the wall in which balancer won't try to take another step

Item.name: minLegHeight
Item.description: minimum height of pelvis above feet at which fallOverWall is attempted

Item.name: bodyTwist
Item.description: amount of twist to apply to the spine as the character tries to fling himself over the wall, provides more of a believable roll but increases the amount of lateral space the character needs to successfully flip.

Item.name: maxTwist
Item.description: max angle the character can twist before twsit helper torques are turned off

Item.name: fallOverWallEndA
Item.description: One end of the wall to try to fall over.

Item.name: fallOverWallEndB
Item.description: One end of the wall over which we are trying to fall over.

Item.name: forceAngleAbort
Item.description: The angle abort threshold.

Item.name: forceTimeOut
Item.description: The force time out.

Item.name: moveArms
Item.description: Lift the arms up if true. Do nothing with the arms if false (eg when using catchfall arms or brace etc)

Item.name: moveLegs
Item.description: Move the legs if true. Do nothing with the legs if false (eg when using dynamicBalancer etc)

Item.name: bendSpine
Item.description: Bend spine to help falloverwall if true. Do nothing with the spine if false.

Item.name: angleDirWithWallNormal
Item.description: Maximum angle in degrees (between the direction of the velocity of the COM and the wall normal) to start to apply forces and torques to fall over the wall.

Item.name: leaningAngleThreshold
Item.description: Maximum angle in degrees (between the vertical vector and a vector from pelvis to lower neck) to start to apply forces and torques to fall over the wall.

Item.name: maxAngVel
Item.description: if the angular velocity is higher than maxAngVel, the torques and forces are not applied.

Item.name: adaptForcesToLowWall
Item.description: Will reduce the magnitude of the forces applied to the character to help him to fall over wall

Item.name: maxWallHeight
Item.description: Maximum height (from the lowest foot) to start to apply forces and torques to fall over the wall.

Item.name: distanceToSendSuccessMessage
Item.description: Minimum distance between the pelvis and the wall to send the success message. If negative doesn't take this parameter into account when sending feedback.

Item.name: rollingBackThr
Item.description: Value of the angular velocity about the wallEgde above which the character is considered as rolling backwards i.e. goes in to fow_RollingBack state

Item.name: rollingPotential
Item.description: On impact with the wall if the rollingPotential(calculated from the characters linear velocity w.r.t the wall) is greater than this value the character will try to go over the wall otherwise it won't try (fow_Aborted).

Item.name: useArmIK
Item.description: Try to reach the wallEdge. To configure the IK : use limitAngleBack, limitAngleFront and limitAngleTotallyBack.

Item.name: reachDistanceFromHitPoint
Item.description: distance from predicted hitpoint where each hands will try to reach the wall.

Item.name: minReachDistanceFromHitPoint
Item.description: minimal distance from predicted hitpoint where each hands will try to reach the wall. Used if the hand target is outside the wall Edge.

Item.name: angleTotallyBack
Item.description: max angle in degrees (between 1.the vector between two hips and 2. wallEdge) to try to reach the wall just behind his pelvis with his arms when the character is back to the wall.

Item.name: grab
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: useLeft
Item.description: Flag to toggle use of left hand

Item.name: useRight
Item.description: Flag to toggle the use of the Right hand

Item.name: dropWeaponIfNecessary
Item.description: if hasn't grabbed when weapon carrying hand is close to target, grab anyway

Item.name: dropWeaponDistance
Item.description: distance below which a weapon carrying hand will request weapon to be dropped

Item.name: grabStrength
Item.description: strength in hands for grabbing (kg m/s), -1 to ignore/disable

Item.name: stickyHands
Item.description: strength of cheat force on hands to pull towards target and stick to target ("cleverHandIK" strength)

Item.name: turnToTarget
Item.description: 0=don't turn, 1=turnToTarget, 2=turnAwayFromTarget

Item.name: grabHoldMaxTimer
Item.description: amount of time, in seconds, before grab automatically bails

Item.name: pullUpTime
Item.description: Time to reach the full pullup strength

Item.name: pullUpStrengthRight
