Item.description: Strength to pull up with the right arm. 0 = no pull up.

Item.name: pullUpStrengthLeft
Item.description: Strength to pull up with the left arm. 0 = no pull up.

Item.name: pos1
Item.description: Grab pos1, right hand if not using line or surface grab.

Item.name: pos2
Item.description: Grab pos2, left hand if not using line or surface grab.

Item.name: normalR
Item.description: Normal for the right grab point.

Item.name: normalL
Item.description: Normal for the left grab point.

Item.name: normalR2
Item.description: Normal for the 2nd right grab point (if pointsX4grab=true).

Item.name: normalL2
Item.description: Normal for the 3rd left grab point (if pointsX4grab=true).

Item.name: handsCollide
Item.description: Hand collisions on when grabbing (false turns off hand collisions making grab more stable esp. to grab points slightly inside geometry)

Item.name: justBrace
Item.description: Flag to toggle between grabbing and bracing

Item.name: useLineGrab
Item.description: use the line grab, Grab along the line (x-x2)

Item.name: pointsX4grab
Item.description: use 2 point

Item.name: fromEA
Item.description: use 2 point

Item.name: surfaceGrab
Item.description: Toggle surface grab on. Requires pos1,pos2,pos3 and pos4 to be specified.

Item.name: instanceIndex
Item.description: levelIndex of instance to grab (-1 = world coordinates)

Item.name: instancePartIndex
Item.description: boundIndex of part on instance to grab (0 = just use instance coordinates)

Item.name: dontLetGo
Item.description: Once a constraint is made, keep reaching with whatever hand is allowed - no matter what the angle/distance and whether or not the constraint has broken due to constraintForce GT grabStrength. mmmtodo this is a badly named parameter

Item.name: bodyStiffness
Item.description: stiffness of upper body. Scales the arm grab such that the armStiffness is default when this is at default value

Item.name: reachAngle
Item.description: Angle from front at which the grab activates. If the point is outside this angle from front will not try to grab.

Item.name: oneSideReachAngle
Item.description: Angle at which we will only reach with one hand.

Item.name: grabDistance
Item.description: Relative distance at which the grab starts.

Item.name: move2Radius
Item.description: Relative distance (additional to grabDistance - doesn't try to move inside grabDistance)at which the grab tries to use the balancer to move to the grab point.

Item.name: armStiffness
Item.description: Stiffness of the arm.

Item.name: maxReachDistance
Item.description: distance to reach out towards the grab point.

Item.name: orientationConstraintScale
Item.description: scale torque used to rotate hands to face normals

Item.name: maxWristAngle
Item.description: When we are grabbing the max angle the wrist ccan be at before we break the grab.

Item.name: useHeadLookToTarget
Item.description: if true, the character will look at targetForHeadLook after a hand grabs until the end of the behavior. (Before grabbing it looks at the grab target)

Item.name: lookAtGrab
Item.description: if true, the character will look at the grab

Item.name: targetForHeadLook
Item.description: Only used if useHeadLookToTarget is true, the target in world space to look at.

Item.name: headLook
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: damping
Item.description: Damping of the muscles

Item.name: stiffness
Item.description: Stiffness of the muscles

Item.name: instanceIndex
Item.description: levelIndex of object to be looked at. vel parameters are ignored if this is non -1

Item.name: vel
Item.description: The velocity of the point being looked at

Item.name: pos
Item.description: The point being looked at

Item.name: alwaysLook
Item.description: Flag to force always to look

Item.name: eyesHorizontal
Item.description: Keep the eyes horizontal. Use true for impact with cars. Use false if you want better look at target accuracy when the character is on the floor or leaned over alot.

Item.name: alwaysEyesHorizontal
Item.description: Keep the eyes horizontal. Use true for impact with cars. Use false if you want better look at target accuracy when the character is on the floor or leaned over (when not leaned over the eyes are still kept horizontal if eyesHorizontal=true ) alot.

Item.name: twistSpine
Item.description: Allow headlook to twist spine.

Item.name: highFall
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: bodyStiffness
Item.description: stiffness of body. Value feeds through to bodyBalance (synched with defaults), to armsWindmill (14 for this value at default ), legs pedal, head look and roll down stairs directly

Item.name: bodydamping
Item.description: The damping of the joints.

Item.name: catchfalltime
Item.description: The length of time before the impact that the character transitions to the landing.

Item.name: crashOrLandCutOff
Item.description: 0.52angle is 0.868 dot//A threshold for deciding how far away from upright the character needs to be before bailing out (going into a foetal) instead of trying to land (keeping stretched out). NB: never does bailout if ignorWorldCollisions true

Item.name: pdStrength
Item.description: Strength of the controller to keep the character at angle aimAngleBase from vertical.

Item.name: pdDamping
Item.description: Damping multiplier of the controller to keep the character at angle aimAngleBase from vertical. The actual damping is pdDamping*pdStrength*constant*angVel.

Item.name: armAngSpeed
Item.description: arm circling speed in armWindMillAdaptive

Item.name: armAmplitude
Item.description: in armWindMillAdaptive

Item.name: armPhase
Item.description: in armWindMillAdaptive 3.1 opposite for stuntman. 1.0 old default. 0.0 in phase.

Item.name: armBendElbows
Item.description: in armWindMillAdaptive bend the elbows as a function of armAngle. For stuntman true otherwise false.

Item.name: legRadius
Item.description: radius of legs on pedal

Item.name: legAngSpeed
Item.description: in pedal

Item.name: legAsymmetry
Item.description: 0.0 for stuntman. Random offset applied per leg to the angular speed to desynchronise the pedaling - set to 0 to disable, otherwise should be set to less than the angularSpeed value.

Item.name: arms2LegsPhase
Item.description: phase angle between the arms and legs circling angle

Item.name: arms2LegsSync
Item.description: 0=not synched, 1=always synched, 2= synch at start only. Synchs the arms angle to what the leg angle is. All speed/direction parameters of armswindmill are overwritten if = 1. If 2 and you want synced arms/legs then armAngSpeed=legAngSpeed, legAsymmetry = 0.0 (to stop randomizations of the leg cicle speed)

Item.name: armsUp
Item.description: Where to put the arms when preparing to land. Approx 1 = above head, 0 = head height, -1 = down. LT -2.0 use catchFall arms, LT -3.0 use prepare for landing pose if Agent is due to land vertically, feet first.

Item.name: orientateBodyToFallDirection
Item.description: toggle to orientate to fall direction. i.e. orientate so that the character faces the horizontal velocity direction

Item.name: orientateTwist
Item.description: If false don't worry about the twist angle of the character when orientating the character. If false this allows the twist axis of the character to be free (You can get a nice twisting highFall like the one in dieHard 4 when the car goes into the helicopter)

Item.name: orientateMax
Item.description: DEVEL parameter - suggest you don't edit it. Maximum torque the orientation controller can apply. If 0 then no helper torques will be used. 300 will orientate the character soflty for all but extreme angles away from aimAngleBase. If abs (current -aimAngleBase) is getting near 3.0 then this can be reduced to give a softer feel.

Item.name: alanRickman
Item.description: If true then orientate the character to face the point from where it started falling. HighFall like the one in dieHard with Alan Rickman

Item.name: fowardRoll
Item.description: Try to execute a forward Roll on landing

Item.name: useZeroPose_withFowardRoll
Item.description: Blend to a zero pose when forward roll is attempted.

Item.name: aimAngleBase
Item.description: Angle from vertical the pdController is driving to ( positive = forwards)

Item.name: fowardVelRotation
Item.description: scale to add/subtract from aimAngle based on forward speed (Internal)

Item.name: footVelCompScale
Item.description: Scale to change to amount of vel that is added to the foot ik from the velocity (Internal)

Item.name: sideD
Item.description: sideoffset for the feet during prepareForLanding. +ve = right.

Item.name: fowardOffsetOfLegIK
Item.description: Forward offset for the feet during prepareForLanding

Item.name: legL
Item.description: Leg Length for ik (Internal)//unused

Item.name: catchFallCutOff
Item.description: 0.5angle is 0.878 dot. Cutoff to go to the catchFall ( internal) //mmmtodo do like crashOrLandCutOff

Item.name: legStrength
Item.description: Strength of the legs at landing

Item.name: balance
Item.description: If true have enough strength to balance. If false not enough strength in legs to balance (even though bodyBlance called)

Item.name: ignorWorldCollisions
Item.description: Never go into bailout (foetal)

Item.name: adaptiveCircling
Item.description: stuntman type fall. Arm and legs circling direction controlled by angmom and orientation

Item.name: hula
Item.description: With stuntman type fall. Hula reaction if can't see floor and not rotating fast

Item.name: maxSpeedForRecoverableFall
Item.description: Character needs to be moving less than this speed to consider fall as a recoverable one.

Item.name: minSpeedForBrace
Item.description: Character needs to be moving at least this fast horizontally to start bracing for impact if there is an object along its trajectory.

Item.name: landingNormal
Item.description: Ray-cast normal doted with up direction has to be greater than this number to consider object flat enough to land on it.

Item.name: incomingTransforms
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: injuredOnGround
Item.description: InjuredOnGround

Item.name: carried
Item.description: Carried

Item.name: dangle
Item.description: Dangle

Item.name: onFire
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: staggerTime
Item.description: Max time for stumbling around before falling to ground.

Item.name: staggerLeanRate
Item.description: How quickly the character leans hips when staggering.

Item.name: stumbleMaxLeanBack
Item.description: max the character leans hips back when staggering

Item.name: stumbleMaxLeanForward
Item.description: max the character leans hips forwards when staggering

Item.name: armsWindmillWritheBlend
Item.description: Blend armsWindmill with the bodyWrithe arms when character is upright.

Item.name: spineStumbleWritheBlend
Item.description: Blend spine stumble with the bodyWrithe spine when character is upright.

Item.name: legsStumbleWritheBlend
Item.description: Blend legs stumble with the bodyWrithe legs when character is upright.

Item.name: armsPoseWritheBlend
Item.description: Blend the bodyWrithe arms with the current desired pose from on fire behaviour when character is on the floor.

Item.name: spinePoseWritheBlend
Item.description: Blend the bodyWrithe back with the current desired pose from on fire behaviour when character is on the floor.

Item.name: legsPoseWritheBlend
Item.description: Blend the bodyWrithe legs with the current desired pose from on fire behaviour when character is on the floor.

Item.name: rollOverFlag
Item.description: Flag to set bodyWrithe trying to rollOver.

Item.name: rollTorqueScale
Item.description: Scale rolling torque that is applied to character spine by bodyWrithe. Torque magnitude is calculated with the following formula: m_rollOverDirection*rollOverPhase*rollTorqueScale.

Item.name: predictTime
Item.description: Character pose depends on character facing direction that is evaluated from its COMTM orientation. Set this value to 0 to use no orientation prediction i.e. current character COMTM orientation will be used to determine character facing direction and finally the pose bodyWrithe is blending to. Set this value to GT 0 to predict character COMTM orientation this amout of time in seconds to the future.

Item.name: maxRollOverTime
Item.description: Rolling torque is ramped down over time. At this time in seconds torque value converges to zero. Use this parameter to restrict time the character is rolling.

Item.name: rollOverRadius
Item.description: Rolling torque is ramped down with distance measured from position where character hit the ground and started rolling. At this distance in meters torque value converges to zero. Use this parameter to restrict distance the character travels due to rolling.

Item.name: pedalLegs
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: pedalLeftLeg
Item.description: pedal with this leg or not

Item.name: pedalRightLeg
Item.description: pedal with this leg or not

Item.name: backPedal
Item.description: pedal forwards or backwards

Item.name: radius
Item.description: base radius of pedal action

Item.name: angularSpeed
Item.description: rate of pedaling. If adaptivePedal4Dragging is true then the legsAngularSpeed calculated to match the linear speed of the character can have a maximum value of angularSpeed (this max used to be hard coded to 13.0)

Item.name: legStiffness
Item.description: stiffness of legs

Item.name: pedalOffset
Item.description: Move the centre of the pedal for the left leg up by this amount, the right leg down by this amount

Item.name: randomSeed
Item.description: Random seed used to generate speed changes

Item.name: speedAsymmetry
Item.description: Random offset applied per leg to the angular speed to desynchronise the pedaling - set to 0 to disable, otherwise should be set to less than the angularSpeed value.

Item.name: adaptivePedal4Dragging
Item.description: Will pedal in the direction of travel (if backPedal = false, against travel if backPedal = true) and with an angular velocity relative to speed upto a maximum of 13(rads/sec). Use when being dragged by a car. Overrides angularSpeed.

Item.name: angSpeedMultiplier4Dragging
Item.description: newAngularSpeed = Clamp(angSpeedMultiplier4Dragging * linear_speed/pedalRadius, 0.0, angularSpeed)

Item.name: radiusVariance
Item.description: 0-1 value used to add variance to the radius value while pedalling, to desynchonize the legs' movement and provide some variety

Item.name: legAngleVariance
Item.description: 0-1 value used to vary the angle of the legs from the hips during the pedal

Item.name: centreSideways
Item.description: Move the centre of the pedal for both legs sideways (+ve = right). NB: not applied to hula.

Item.name: centreForwards
Item.description: Move the centre of the pedal for both legs forward (or backward -ve)

Item.name: centreUp
Item.description: Move the centre of the pedal for both legs up (or down -ve)

Item.name: ellipse
Item.description: Turn the circle into an ellipse. Ellipse has horizontal radius a and vertical radius b. If ellipse is +ve then a=radius*ellipse and b=radius. If ellipse is -ve then a=radius and b = radius*ellipse. 0.0 = vertical line of length 2*radius, 0.0:1.0 circle squashed horizontally (vertical radius = radius), 1.0=circle. -0.001 = horizontal line of length 2*radius, -0.0:-1.0 circle squashed vertically (horizontal radius = radius), -1.0 = circle

Item.name: dragReduction
Item.description: how much to account for the target moving through space rather than being static

Item.name: spread
Item.description: Spread legs.

Item.name: hula
Item.description: If true circle the legs in a hula motion.

Item.name: pointArm
Item.description: pointArm:BEHAVIOURS REFERENCED: AnimPose - allows animPose to overridebodyParts: Arms (useLeftArm, useRightArm)

Item.name: targetLeft
Item.description: point to point to (in world space)

Item.name: twistLeft
Item.description: twist of the arm around point direction

Item.name: armStraightnessLeft
Item.description: values less than 1 can give the arm a more bent look

Item.name: armStiffnessLeft
Item.description: stiffness of arm

Item.name: armDampingLeft
Item.description: damping value for arm used to point

Item.name: instanceIndexLeft
Item.description: level index of thing to point at, or -1 for none. if -1, target is specified in world space, otherwise it is an offset from the object specified by this index.

Item.name: pointSwingLimitLeft
Item.description: Swing limit

Item.name: targetRight
Item.description: point to point to (in world space)

Item.name: twistRight
Item.description: twist of the arm around point direction

Item.name: armStraightnessRight
Item.description: values less than 1 can give the arm a more bent look

Item.name: armStiffnessRight
Item.description: stiffness of arm

Item.name: armDampingRight
Item.description: damping value for arm used to point

Item.name: instanceIndexRight
Item.description: level index of thing to point at, or -1 for none. if -1, target is specified in world space, otherwise it is an offset from the object specified by this index.

Item.name: pointSwingLimitRight
Item.description: Swing limit

Item.name: pointGun
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: enableRight
Item.description: Allow right hand to point/support?

Item.name: enableLeft
Item.description: Allow right hand to point/support?

Item.name: leftHandTarget
Item.description: Target for the left Hand

Item.name: leftHandTargetIndex
Item.description: Index of the object that the left hand target is specified in, -1 is world space.

Item.name: rightHandTarget
Item.description: Target for the right Hand

Item.name: rightHandTargetIndex
Item.description: Index of the object that the right hand target is specified in, -1 is world space.

Item.name: leadTarget
Item.description: NB: Only Applied to single handed weapons (some more work is required to have this tech on two handed weapons). Amount to lead target based on target velocity relative to the chest.

Item.name: armStiffness
Item.description: Stiffness of the arm.

Item.name: armStiffnessDetSupport
Item.description: Stiffness of the arm on pointing arm when a support arm is detached from a two-handed weapon.

Item.name: armDamping
Item.description: Damping.

Item.name: gravityOpposition
Item.description: Amount of gravity opposition on pointing arm.

Item.name: gravOppDetachedSupport
Item.description: Amount of gravity opposition on pointing arm when a support arm is detached from a two-handed weapon.

Item.name: massMultDetachedSupport
Item.description: Amount of mass of weapon taken into account by gravity opposition on pointing arm when a support arm is detached from a two-handed weapon. The lower the value the more the character doesn't know about the weapon mass and therefore is more affected by it.

Item.name: allowShotLooseness
Item.description: Allow shot to set a lower arm muscleStiffness than pointGun normally would.

Item.name: clavicleBlend
Item.description: How much of blend should come from incoming transforms 0(all IK) .. 1(all ITMs) For pointing arms only. (Support arm uses the IK solution as is for clavicles)

Item.name: elbowAttitude
Item.description: Controls arm twist. (except in pistolIK)

Item.name: supportConstraint
Item.description: Type of constraint between the support hand and gun. 0=no constraint, 1=hard distance constraint, 2=Force based constraint, 3=hard spherical constraint

Item.name: constraintMinDistance
Item.description: For supportConstraint = 1: Support hand constraint distance will be slowly reduced until it hits this value. This is for stability and also allows the pointing arm to lead a little. Don't set lower than NM_MIN_STABLE_DISTANCECONSTRAINT_DISTANCE 0.001f

Item.name: makeConstraintDistance
Item.description: For supportConstraint = 1: Minimum distance within which support hand constraint will be made.

Item.name: reduceConstraintLengthVel
Item.description: For supportConstraint = 1: Velocity at which to reduce the support hand constraint length

Item.name: breakingStrength
Item.description: For supportConstraint = 1: strength of the supporting hands constraint (kg m/s), -1 to ignore/disable

Item.name: brokenSupportTime
Item.description: Once constraint is broken then do not try to reconnect/support for this amount of time

Item.name: brokenToSideProb
Item.description: Probability that the when a constraint is broken that during brokenSupportTime a side pose will be selected.

Item.name: connectAfter
Item.description: If gunArm has been controlled by other behaviours for this time when it could have been pointing but couldn't due to pointing only allowed if connected, change gunArm pose to something that could connect for connectFor seconds

Item.name: connectFor
Item.description: Time to try to reconnect for

Item.name: oneHandedPointing
Item.description: 0 = don't allow, 1= allow for kPistol(two handed pistol) only, 2 = allow for kRifle only, 3 = allow for kPistol and kRifle. Allow one handed pointing - no constraint if cant be supported . If not allowed then gunHand does not try to point at target if it cannot be supported - the constraint will be controlled by always support.

Item.name: alwaysSupport
Item.description: Support a non pointing gunHand i.e. if in zero pose (constrain as well if constraint possible)

Item.name: poseUnusedGunArm
Item.description: Apply neutral pose when a gun arm isn't in use. NB: at the moment Rifle hand is always controlled by pointGun.

Item.name: poseUnusedSupportArm
Item.description: Apply neutral pose when a support arm isn't in use.

Item.name: poseUnusedOtherArm
Item.description: Apply neutral pose to the non-gun arm (otherwise it is always under the control of other behaviours or not set). If the non-gun hand is a supporting hand it is not controlled by this parameter but by poseUnusedSupportArm

Item.name: maxAngleAcross
Item.description: max aiming angle(deg) sideways across body midline measured from chest forward that the character will try to point

Item.name: maxAngleAway
Item.description: max aiming angle(deg) sideways away from body midline measured from chest forward that the character will try to point

Item.name: fallingLimits
Item.description: 0= don't apply limits. 1=apply the limits below only when the character is falling. 2 = always apply these limits (instead of applying maxAngleAcross and maxAngleAway which only limits the horizontal angle but implicity limits the updown (the limit shape is a vertical hinge)

Item.name: acrossLimit
Item.description: max aiming angle(deg) sideways across body midline measured from chest forward that the character will try to point. i.e. for rightHanded gun this is the angle left of the midline

Item.name: awayLimit
Item.description: max aiming angle(deg) sideways away from body midline measured from chest forward that the character will try to point. i.e. for rightHanded gun this is the angle right of the midline

Item.name: upLimit
Item.description: max aiming angle(deg) upwards from body midline measured from chest forward that the character will try to point.

Item.name: downLimit
Item.description: max aiming angle(deg) downwards from body midline measured from chest forward that the character will try to point

Item.name: rifleFall
Item.description: Pose the rifle hand to reduce complications with collisions. 0 = false, 1 = always when falling, 2 = when falling except if falling backwards

Item.name: fallingSupport
Item.description: Allow supporting of a rifle(or two handed pistol) when falling. 0 = false, 1 = support if allowed, 2 = support until constraint not active (don't allow support to restart), 3 = support until constraint not effective (support hand to support distance must be less than 0.15 - don't allow support to restart).

Item.name: fallingTypeSupport
Item.description: What is considered a fall by fallingSupport). Apply fallingSupport 0=never(will support if allowed), 1 = falling, 2 = falling except if falling backwards, 3 = falling and collided, 4 = falling and collided except if falling backwards, 5 = falling except if falling backwards until collided

Item.name: pistolNeutralType
Item.description: 0 = byFace, 1=acrossFront, 2=bySide. NB: bySide is not connectible so be careful if combined with kPistol and oneHandedPointing = 0 or 2

Item.name: neutralPoint4Pistols
Item.description: NOT IMPLEMENTED YET KEEP=false - use pointing for neutral targets in pistol modes

Item.name: neutralPoint4Rifle
Item.description: use pointing for neutral targets in rifle mode

Item.name: checkNeutralPoint
Item.description: Check the neutral pointing is pointable, if it isn't then choose a neutral pose instead

Item.name: point2Side
Item.description: side, up, back) side is left for left arm, right for right arm mmmmtodo

Item.name: add2WeaponDistSide
Item.description: add to weaponDistance for point2Side neutral pointing (to straighten the arm)

Item.name: point2Connect
Item.description: side, up, back) side is left for left arm, right for rght arm mmmmtodo

Item.name: add2WeaponDistConnect
Item.description: add to weaponDistance for point2Connect neutral pointing (to straighten the arm)

Item.name: usePistolIK
Item.description: enable new ik for pistol pointing.

Item.name: useSpineTwist
Item.description: Use spine twist to orient chest?

Item.name: useTurnToTarget
Item.description: Turn balancer to help gun point at target

Item.name: useHeadLook
Item.description: Use head look to drive head?

Item.name: errorThreshold
Item.description: angular difference between pointing direction and target direction above which feedback will be generated.

Item.name: fireWeaponRelaxTime
Item.description: Duration of arms relax following firing weapon. NB:This is clamped (0,5) in pointGun

Item.name: fireWeaponRelaxAmount
Item.description: Relax multiplier following firing weapon. Recovers over relaxTime.

Item.name: fireWeaponRelaxDistance
Item.description: Range of motion for ik-based recoil.

Item.name: useIncomingTransforms
Item.description: Use the incoming transforms to inform the pointGun of the primaryWeaponDistance, poleVector for the arm

Item.name: measureParentOffset
Item.description: If useIncomingTransforms = true and measureParentOffset=true then measure the Pointing-from offset from parent effector, using itms - this should point the barrel of the gun to the target. This is added to the rightHandParentOffset. NB NOT used if rightHandParentEffector LT 0

Item.name: leftHandParentOffset
Item.description: Pointing-from offset from parent effector, expressed in spine3's frame, x = back/forward, y = right/left, z = up/down.

Item.name: leftHandParentEffector
Item.description: 1 = Use leftShoulder. Effector from which the left hand pointing originates. ie, point from this part to the target. -1 causes default offset for active weapon mode to be applied.

Item.name: rightHandParentOffset
Item.description: Pointing-from offset from parent effector, expressed in spine3's frame, x = back/forward, y = right/left, z = up/down. This is added to the measured one if useIncomingTransforms=true and measureParentOffset=true. NB NOT used if rightHandParentEffector LT 0. Pistol(0,0,0) Rifle(0.0032, 0.0, -0.0)

Item.name: rightHandParentEffector
Item.description: 1 = Use rightShoulder.. Effector from which the right hand pointing originates. ie, point from this part to the target. -1 causes default offset for active weapon mode to be applied.

Item.name: primaryHandWeaponDistance
Item.description: Distance from the shoulder to hold the weapon. If -1 and useIncomingTransforms then weaponDistance is read from ITMs. weaponDistance=primaryHandWeaponDistance clamped [0.2f:m_maxArmReach=0.65] if useIncomingTransforms = false. pistol 0.60383, rifle 0.336

Item.name: constrainRifle
Item.description: Use hard constraint to keep rifle stock against shoulder?

Item.name: rifleConstraintMinDistance
Item.description: Rifle constraint distance. Deliberately kept large to create a flat constraint surface where rifle meets the shoulder.

Item.name: disableArmCollisions
Item.description: Disable collisions between right hand/forearm and the torso/legs.

Item.name: disableRifleCollisions
Item.description: Disable collisions between right hand/forearm and spine3/spine2 if in rifle mode.

Item.name: pointGunExtra
Item.description: pointGunExtra: Seldom set parameters for pointGun - just to keep number of parameters in any message less than or equal to 64

Item.name: constraintStrength
Item.description: For supportConstraint = 2: force constraint strength of the supporting hands - it gets shaky at about 4.0

Item.name: constraintThresh
Item.description: For supportConstraint = 2: Like makeConstraintDistance. Force starts acting when the hands are LT 3.0*thresh apart but is maximum strength LT thresh. For comparison: 0.1 is used for reachForWound in shot, 0.25 is used in grab.

Item.name: weaponMask
Item.description: Currently unused - no intoWorldTest. RAGE bit mask to exclude weapons from ray probe - currently defaults to MP3 weapon flag

Item.name: timeWarpActive
Item.description: Is timeWarpActive enabled?

Item.name: timeWarpStrengthScale
Item.description: Scale for arm and helper strength when timewarp is enabled. 1 = normal compensation.

Item.name: oriStiff
Item.description: Hand stabilization controller stiffness.

Item.name: oriDamp
Item.description: Hand stabilization controller damping.

Item.name: posStiff
Item.description: Hand stabilization controller stiffness.

Item.name: posDamp
Item.description: Hand stabilization controller damping.

Item.name: rollDownStairs
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: stiffness
Item.description: Effector Stiffness. value feeds through to rollUp directly

Item.name: damping
Item.description: Effector Damping.

Item.name: forcemag
Item.description: Helper force strength. Do not go above 1 for a rollDownStairs/roll along ground reaction.

Item.name: m_useArmToSlowDown
Item.description: the degree to which the character will try to stop a barrel roll with his arms

Item.name: useZeroPose
Item.description: Blends between a zeroPose and the Rollup, Faster the character is rotating the less the zeroPose

Item.name: spinWhenInAir
Item.description: Applied cheat forces to spin the character when in the air, the forces are 40% of the forces applied when touching the ground. Be careful little bunny rabbits, the character could spin unnaturally in the air.

Item.name: m_armReachAmount
Item.description: how much the character reaches with his arms to brace against the ground

Item.name: m_legPush
Item.description: amount that the legs push outwards when tumbling

Item.name: tryToAvoidHeadButtingGround
Item.description: Blends between a zeroPose and the Rollup, Faster the character is rotating the less the zeroPose

Item.name: armReachLength
Item.description: the length that the arm reaches and so how much it straightens

Item.name: customRollDir
Item.description: pass in a custom direction in to have the character try and roll in that direction

Item.name: useCustomRollDir
Item.description: pass in true to use the customRollDir parameter

Item.name: stiffnessDecayTarget
Item.description: The target linear velocity used to start the rolling.

Item.name: stiffnessDecayTime
Item.description: time, in seconds, to decay stiffness down to the stiffnessDecayTarget value (or -1 to disable)

Item.name: asymmetricalLegs
Item.description: 0 is no leg asymmetry in 'foetal' position. greater than 0 a asymmetricalLegs-rand(30%), added/minus each joint of the legs in radians. Random number changes about once every roll. 0.4 gives a lot of asymmetry

Item.name: zAxisSpinReduction
Item.description: Tries to reduce the spin around the z axis. Scale 0 - 1

Item.name: targetLinearVelocityDecayTime
Item.description: Time for the targetlinearVelocity to decay to zero.

Item.name: targetLinearVelocity
Item.description: Helper torques are applied to match the spin of the character to the max of targetLinearVelocity and COMVelMag

Item.name: onlyApplyHelperForces
Item.description: Don't use rollup if true

Item.name: useVelocityOfObjectBelow
Item.description: scale applied cheat forces/torques to (zero) if object underneath character has velocity greater than 1.f

Item.name: useRelativeVelocity
Item.description: useVelocityOfObjectBelow uses a relative velocity of the character to the object underneath

Item.name: applyFoetalToLegs
Item.description: if true, use rollup for upper body and a kind of foetal behavior for legs

Item.name: movementLegsInFoetalPosition
Item.description: Only used if applyFoetalToLegs = true : define the variation of angles for the joints of the legs

Item.name: maxAngVelAroundFrontwardAxis
Item.description: Only used if applyNewRollingCheatingTorques or applyHelPerTorqueToAlign defined to true : maximal angular velocity around frontward axis of the pelvis to apply cheating torques.

Item.name: minAngVel
Item.description: Only used if applyNewRollingCheatingTorques or applyHelPerTorqueToAlign defined to true : minimal angular velocity of the roll to apply cheating torques

Item.name: applyNewRollingCheatingTorques
Item.description: if true will use the new way to apply cheating torques (like in fallOverWall), otherwise will use the old way

Item.name: maxAngVel
Item.description: Only used if applyNewRollingCheatingTorques defined to true : maximal angular velocity of the roll to apply cheating torque

Item.name: magOfTorqueToRoll
Item.description: Only used if applyNewRollingCheatingTorques defined to true : magnitude of the torque to roll down the stairs

Item.name: applyHelPerTorqueToAlign
Item.description: apply torque to align the body orthogonally to the direction of the roll

Item.name: delayToAlignBody
Item.description: Only used if applyHelPerTorqueToAlign defined to true : delay to start to apply torques

Item.name: magOfTorqueToAlign
Item.description: Only used if applyHelPerTorqueToAlign defined to true : magnitude of the torque to align orthogonally the body

Item.name: airborneReduction
Item.description: Ordinarily keep at 0.85. Make this lower if you want spinning in the air.

Item.name: applyMinMaxFriction
Item.description: Pass-through to Roll Up. Controls whether or not behaviour enforces min/max friction.

Item.name: limitSpinReduction
Item.description: Scale zAxisSpinReduction back when rotating end-over-end (somersault) to give the body a chance to align with the axis of rotation.

Item.name: shot
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: bodyStiffness
Item.description: stiffness of body. Feeds through to roll_up

Item.name: spineDamping
Item.description: stiffness of body. Feeds through to roll_up

Item.name: armStiffness
Item.description: arm stiffness

Item.name: initialNeckStiffness
Item.description: initial stiffness of neck after being shot.

Item.name: initialNeckDamping
Item.description: intial damping of neck after being shot.

Item.name: neckStiffness
Item.description: stiffness of neck.

Item.name: neckDamping
Item.description: damping of neck.

Item.name: kMultOnLoose
Item.description: how much to add to upperbody stiffness dependent on looseness

Item.name: kMult4Legs
Item.description: how much to add to leg stiffnesses dependent on looseness

Item.name: loosenessAmount
Item.description: how loose the character is made by a newBullet. between 0 and 1

Item.name: looseness4Fall
Item.description: how loose the character is made by a newBullet if falling

Item.name: looseness4Stagger
Item.description: how loose the upperBody of the character is made by a newBullet if staggerFall is running (and not falling). Note atm the neck ramp values are ignored in staggerFall

Item.name: minArmsLooseness
Item.description: minimum looseness to apply to the arms

Item.name: minLegsLooseness
Item.description: minimum looseness to apply to the Legs

Item.name: grabHoldTime
Item.description: how long to hold for before returning to relaxed arm position

Item.name: spineBlendExagCPain
Item.description: true: spine is blended with zero pose, false: spine is blended with zero pose if not setting exag or cpain

Item.name: spineBlendZero
Item.description: spine is always blended with zero pose this much and up to 1 as the character become stationary. If negative no blend is ever applied.

Item.name: bulletProofVest
Item.description: looseness applied to spine is different if bulletProofVest is true

Item.name: alwaysResetLooseness
Item.description: looseness always reset on shotNewBullet even if previous looseness ramp still running. Except for the neck which has it's own ramp.

Item.name: alwaysResetNeckLooseness
Item.description: Neck looseness always reset on shotNewBullet even if previous looseness ramp still running

Item.name: angVelScale
Item.description: How much to scale the angular velocity coming in from animation of a part if it is in angVelScaleMask (otherwise scale by 1.0)

Item.name: angVelScaleMask
Item.description: Parts to scale the initial angular velocity by angVelScale (otherwize scale by 1.0)

Item.name: flingWidth
Item.description: Width of the fling behaviour.

Item.name: flingTime
Item.description: Duration of the fling behaviour.

Item.name: timeBeforeReachForWound
Item.description: time, in seconds, before the character begins to grab for the wound on the first hit

Item.name: exagDuration
Item.description: exaggerate bullet duration (at exagMag/exagTwistMag)

Item.name: exagMag
Item.description: exaggerate bullet spine Lean magnitude

Item.name: exagTwistMag
Item.description: exaggerate bullet spine Twist magnitude

Item.name: exagSmooth2Zero
Item.description: exaggerate bullet duration ramping to zero after exagDuration

Item.name: exagZeroTime
Item.description: exaggerate bullet time spent at 0 spine lean/twist after exagDuration + exagSmooth2Zero

Item.name: cpainSmooth2Time
Item.description: conscious pain duration ramping from zero to cpainMag/cpainTwistMag

Item.name: cpainDuration
Item.description: conscious pain duration at cpainMag/cpainTwistMag after cpainSmooth2Time

Item.name: cpainMag
Item.description: conscious pain spine Lean(back/Forward) magnitude (Replaces spinePainMultiplier)

Item.name: cpainTwistMag
Item.description: conscious pain spine Twist/Lean2Side magnitude Replaces spinePainTwistMultiplier)

Item.name: cpainSmooth2Zero
Item.description: conscious pain ramping to zero after cpainSmooth2Time + cpainDuration (Replaces spinePainTime)

Item.name: crouching
Item.description: is the guy crouching or not

Item.name: chickenArms
Item.description: Type of reaction

Item.name: reachForWound
Item.description: Type of reaction

Item.name: fling
Item.description: Type of reaction

Item.name: allowInjuredArm
Item.description: injured arm code runs if arm hit (turns and steps and bends injured arm)

Item.name: allowInjuredLeg
Item.description: when false injured leg is not bent and character does not bend to reach it

Item.name: allowInjuredLowerLegReach
Item.description: when false don't try to reach for injured Lower Legs (shins/feet)

Item.name: allowInjuredThighReach
Item.description: when false don't try to reach for injured Thighs

Item.name: stableHandsAndNeck
Item.description: additional stability for hands and neck (less loose)

Item.name: fallingReaction
Item.description: 0=Rollup, 1=Catchfall, 2=rollDownStairs, 3=smartFall

Item.name: useExtendedCatchFall
Item.description: keep the character active instead of relaxing at the end of the catch fall

Item.name: initialWeaknessZeroDuration
Item.description: duration for which the character's upper body stays at minimum stiffness (not quite zero)

Item.name: initialWeaknessRampDuration
Item.description: duration of the ramp to bring the character's upper body stiffness back to normal levels

Item.name: initialNeckDuration
Item.description: duration for which the neck stays at intial stiffness/damping

Item.name: initialNeckRampDuration
Item.description: duration of the ramp to bring the neck stiffness/damping back to normal levels

Item.name: useCStrModulation
Item.description: if enabled upper and lower body strength scales with character strength, using the range given by parameters below

Item.name: cStrUpperMin
Item.description: proportions to what the strength would be normally

Item.name: deathTime
Item.description: time to death (HACK for underwater). If -ve don't ever die

Item.name: shotNewBullet
Item.description: shotNewBullet: Send new wound information to the shot. Can cause shot to restart it's performance in part or in whole.

Item.name: bodyPart
Item.description: part ID on the body where the bullet hit

Item.name: localHitPointInfo
Item.description: if true then normal and hitPoint should be supplied in local coordinates of bodyPart. If false then normal and hitPoint should be supplied in World coordinates

Item.name: normal
Item.description: Normal coming out of impact point on character. Can be local or global depending on localHitPointInfo

Item.name: hitPoint
Item.description: position of impact on character. Can be local or global depending on localHitPointInfo

Item.name: bulletVel
Item.description: bullet velocity in world coordinates

Item.name: shotSnap
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: snap
Item.description: Add a Snap to shot.

Item.name: snapMag
Item.description: The magnitude of the reaction

Item.name: snapMovingMult
Item.description: movingMult*snapMag = The magnitude of the reaction if moving(comVelMag) faster than movingThresh

Item.name: snapBalancingMult
Item.description: balancingMult*snapMag = The magnitude of the reaction if balancing = (not lying on the floor/ not upper body not collided) and not airborne

Item.name: snapAirborneMult
Item.description: airborneMult*snapMag = The magnitude of the reaction if airborne

Item.name: snapMovingThresh
Item.description: If moving(comVelMag) faster than movingThresh then mvingMult applied to stunMag

Item.name: snapDirectionRandomness
Item.description: The character snaps in a prescribed way (decided by bullet direction) - Higher the value the more random this direction is.

Item.name: snapLeftArm
Item.description: snap the leftArm.

Item.name: snapRightArm
Item.description: snap the rightArm.

Item.name: snapLeftLeg
Item.description: snap the leftLeg.

Item.name: snapRightLeg
Item.description: snap the rightLeg.

Item.name: snapSpine
Item.description: snap the spine.

Item.name: snapNeck
Item.description: snap the neck.

Item.name: snapPhasedLegs
Item.description: Legs are either in phase with each other or not

Item.name: snapHipType
Item.description: type of hip reaction 0=none, 1=side2side 2=steplike

Item.name: snapUseBulletDir
Item.description: Legs are either in phase with each other or not

Item.name: snapHitPart
Item.description: Snap only around the wounded part//mmmmtodo check whether bodyPart doesn't have to be remembered for unSnap

Item.name: unSnapInterval
Item.description: Interval before applying reverse snap

Item.name: unSnapRatio
Item.description: The magnitude of the reverse snap

Item.name: snapUseTorques
Item.description: use torques to make the snap otherwise use a change in the parts angular velocity

Item.name: shotShockSpin
Item.description: shotShockSpin: configure the shockSpin effect in shot. Spin/Lift the character using cheat torques/forces

Item.name: addShockSpin
Item.description: if enabled, add a short 'shock' of torque to the character's spine to exaggerate bullet impact

Item.name: randomizeShockSpinDirection
Item.description: for use with close-range shotgun blasts, or similar

Item.name: alwaysAddShockSpin
Item.description: if true, apply the shock spin no matter which body component was hit. otherwise only apply if the spine or clavicles get hit

Item.name: shockSpinMin
Item.description: minimum amount of torque to add if using shock-spin feature

Item.name: shockSpinMax
Item.description: maxiumum amount of torque to add if using shock-spin feature

Item.name: shockSpinLiftForceMult
Item.description: if greater than 0, apply a force to lift the character up while the torque is applied, trying to produce a dramatic spun/twist shotgun-to-the-chest effect. this is a scale of the torque applied, so 8.0 or so would give a reasonable amount of lift

Item.name: shockSpinDecayMult
Item.description: multiplier used when decaying torque spin over time

Item.name: shockSpinScalePerComponent
Item.description: torque applied is scaled by this amount across the spine components - spine2 recieving the full amount, then 3 and 1 and finally 0. each time, this value is used to scale it down. 0.5 means half the torque each time.

Item.name: shockSpinMaxTwistVel
Item.description: shock spin ends when twist velocity is greater than this value (try 6.0). If set to -1 does not stop

Item.name: shockSpinScaleByLeverArm
Item.description: shock spin scales by lever arm of bullet i.e. bullet impact point to centre line

Item.name: shockSpinAirMult
Item.description: shockSpin's torque is multipied by this value when both the character's feet are not in contact

Item.name: shockSpin1FootMult
Item.description: shockSpin's torque is multipied by this value when the one of the character's feet are not in contact

Item.name: shockSpinFootGripMult
Item.description: shockSpin scales the torques applied to the feet by footSlipCompensation

Item.name: bracedSideSpinMult
Item.description: If shot on a side with a forward foot and both feet are on the ground and balanced, increase the shockspin to compensate for the balancer naturally resisting spin to that side

Item.name: shotFallToKnees
Item.description: shotFallToKnees: configure the fall to knees shot.

Item.name: fallToKnees
Item.description: Type of reaction

Item.name: ftkAlwaysChangeFall
Item.description: Always change fall behaviour. If false only change when falling forward

Item.name: ftkBalanceTime
Item.description: How long the balancer runs for before fallToKnees starts

Item.name: ftkHelperForce
Item.description: Hip helper force magnitude - to help character lean over balance point of line between toes

Item.name: ftkHelperForceOnSpine
Item.description: Helper force applied to spine3 aswell

Item.name: ftkLeanHelp
Item.description: Help balancer lean amount - to help character lean over balance point of line between toes. Half of this is also applied as hipLean

Item.name: ftkSpineBend
Item.description: Bend applied to spine when falling from knees. (+ve forward - try -0.1) (only if rds called)

Item.name: ftkStiffSpine
Item.description: Stiffen spine when falling from knees (only if rds called)

Item.name: ftkImpactLooseness
Item.description: Looseness (muscleStiffness = 1.01f - m_parameters.ftkImpactLooseness) applied to upperBody on knee impacts

Item.name: ftkImpactLoosenessTime
Item.description: Time that looseness is applied after knee impacts

Item.name: ftkBendRate
Item.description: Rate at which the legs are bent to go from standing to on knees

Item.name: ftkHipBlend
Item.description: Blend from current hip to balancing on knees hip angle

Item.name: ftkLungeProb
Item.description: Probability that a lunge reaction will be allowed

Item.name: ftkKneeSpin
Item.description: When on knees allow some spinning of the character. If false then the balancers' footSlipCompensation remains on and tends to keep the character facing the same way as when it was balancing.

Item.name: ftkFricMult
Item.description: Multiplier on the reduction of friction for the feet based on angle away from horizontal - helps the character fall to knees quicker

Item.name: ftkHipAngleFall
Item.description: Apply this hip angle when the character starts to fall backwards when on knees

Item.name: ftkPitchForwards
Item.description: Hip pitch applied (+ve forward, -ve backwards) if character is falling forwards on way down to it's knees

Item.name: ftkPitchBackwards
Item.description: Hip pitch applied (+ve forward, -ve backwards) if character is falling backwards on way down to it's knees

Item.name: ftkFallBelowStab
Item.description: Balancer instability below which the character starts to bend legs even if it isn't going to fall on to it's knees (i.e. if going backwards). 0.3 almost ensures a fall to knees but means the character will keep stepping backward until it slows down enough.

Item.name: ftkBalanceAbortThreshold
Item.description: when the character gives up and goes into a fall

Item.name: ftkOnKneesArmType
Item.description: Type of arm response when on knees falling forward 0=useFallArms (from RollDownstairs or catchFall), 1= armsIn, 2=armsOut

Item.name: ftkReleaseReachForWound
Item.description: Release the reachForWound this amount of time after the knees have hit. If LT 0.0 then keep reaching for wound regardless of fall/onground state.

Item.name: ftkReachForWound
Item.description: true = Keep reaching for wound regardless of fall/onground state. false = respect the shotConfigureArms params: reachFalling, reachFallingWithOneHand, reachOnFloor

Item.name: ftkReleasePointGun
Item.description: Override the pointGun when knees hit

Item.name: ftkFailMustCollide
Item.description: The upper body of the character must be colliding and other failure conditions met to fail

Item.name: shotFromBehind
Item.description: shotFromBehind: configure the shot from behind reaction

Item.name: shotFromBehind
Item.description: Type of reaction

Item.name: sfbSpineAmount
Item.description: SpineBend.

Item.name: sfbNeckAmount
Item.description: Neck Bend.

Item.name: sfbHipAmount
Item.description: hip Pitch

Item.name: sfbKneeAmount
Item.description: knee bend

Item.name: sfbPeriod
Item.description: shotFromBehind reaction period after being shot

Item.name: sfbForceBalancePeriod
Item.description: amount of time not taking a step

Item.name: sfbArmsOnset
Item.description: amount of time before applying spread out arms pose

Item.name: sfbKneesOnset
Item.description: amount of time before bending knees a bit

Item.name: sfbNoiseGain
Item.description: Controls additional independent randomized bending of left/right elbows

Item.name: sfbIgnoreFail
Item.description: 0=balancer fails as normal, 1= ignore backArchedBack and leanedTooFarBack balancer failures, 2= ignore backArchedBack balancer failure only, 3= ignore leanedTooFarBack balancer failure only

Item.name: shotInGuts
Item.description: shotInGuts: configure the shot in guts reaction

Item.name: shotInGuts
Item.description: Type of reaction

Item.name: sigSpineAmount
Item.description: SpineBend.

Item.name: sigNeckAmount
Item.description: Neck Bend.

Item.name: sigHipAmount
Item.description: hip Pitch

Item.name: sigKneeAmount
Item.description: knee bend

Item.name: sigPeriod
Item.description: active time after being shot

Item.name: sigForceBalancePeriod
Item.description: amount of time not taking a step

Item.name: sigKneesOnset
Item.description: amount of time not taking a step

Item.name: shotHeadLook
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: useHeadLook
Item.description: Use headLook. Default: looks at provided target or if this is zero - looks forward or in velocity direction. If reachForWound is enabled, switches between looking at the wound and at the default target.

Item.name: headLook
Item.description: position to look at with headlook flag

Item.name: headLookAtWoundMinTimer
Item.description: Min time to look at wound

Item.name: headLookAtWoundMaxTimer
Item.description: Max time to look at wound

Item.name: headLookAtHeadPosMaxTimer
Item.description: Min time to look headLook or if zero - forward or in velocity direction

Item.name: headLookAtHeadPosMinTimer
Item.description: Max time to look headLook or if zero - forward or in velocity direction

Item.name: shotConfigureArms
Item.description: shotConfigureArms: configure the arm reactions in shot

Item.name: brace
Item.description: blind brace with arms if appropriate

Item.name: pointGun
Item.description: Point gun if appropriate.

Item.name: useArmsWindmill
Item.description: armsWindmill if going backwards fast enough

Item.name: releaseWound
Item.description: release wound if going sideways/forward fast enough. 0 = don't. 1 = only if bracing. 2 = any default arm reaction

Item.name: reachFalling
Item.description: reachForWound when falling 0 = false, 1 = true, 2 = once per shot performance

Item.name: reachFallingWithOneHand
Item.description: Force character to reach for wound with only one hand when falling or fallen. 0= allow 2 handed reach, 1= left only if 2 handed possible, 2= right only if 2 handed possible, 3 = one handed but automatic (allows switching of hands)

Item.name: reachOnFloor
Item.description: reachForWound when on floor - 0 = false, 1 = true, 2 = once per shot performance

Item.name: alwaysReachTime
Item.description: Inhibit arms brace for this amount of time after reachForWound has begun

Item.name: AWSpeedMult
Item.description: For armsWindmill, multiplier on character speed - increase of speed of circling is proportional to character speed (max speed of circliing increase = 1.5). eg. lowering the value increases the range of velocity that the 0-1.5 is applied over

Item.name: AWRadiusMult
Item.description: For armsWindmill, multiplier on character speed - increase of radii is proportional to character speed (max radius increase = 0.45). eg. lowering the value increases the range of velocity that the 0-0.45 is applied over

Item.name: AWStiffnessAdd
Item.description: For armsWindmill, added arm stiffness ranges from 0 to AWStiffnessAdd

Item.name: reachWithOneHand
Item.description: Force character to reach for wound with only one hand. 0= allow 2 handed reach, 1= left only if 2 handed possible, 2= right only if 2 handed possible

Item.name: allowLeftPistolRFW
Item.description: Allow character to reach for wound with left hand if holding a pistol. It never will for a rifle. If pointGun is running this will only happen if the hand cannot point and pointGun:poseUnusedGunArm = false

Item.name: allowRightPistolRFW
Item.description: Allow character to reach for wound with right hand if holding a pistol. It never will for a rifle. If pointGun is running this will only happen if the hand cannot point and pointGun:poseUnusedGunArm = false

Item.name: rfwWithPistol
Item.description: Override pointGun and reachForWound if desired if holding a pistol. It never will for a rifle

Item.name: fling2
Item.description: Type of reaction

Item.name: fling2Left
Item.description: Fling the left arm

Item.name: fling2Right
Item.description: Fling the right arm

Item.name: fling2OverrideStagger
Item.description: Override stagger arms even if staggerFall:m_upperBodyReaction = true

Item.name: fling2TimeBefore
Item.description: Time after hit that the fling will start (allows for a bit of loose arm movement from bullet impact.snap etc)

Item.name: fling2Time
Item.description: Duration of the fling behaviour.

Item.name: fling2MStiffL
Item.description: MuscleStiffness of the left arm. If negative then uses the shots underlying muscle stiffness from controlStiffness (i.e. respects looseness)

Item.name: fling2MStiffR
Item.description: MuscleStiffness of the right arm. If negative then uses the shots underlying muscle stiffness from controlStiffness (i.e. respects looseness)

Item.name: fling2RelaxTimeL
Item.description: Maximum time before the left arm relaxes in the fling. It will relax automatically when the arm has completed it's bent arm fling. This is what causes the arm to straighten.

Item.name: fling2RelaxTimeR
Item.description: Maximum time before the right arm relaxes in the fling. It will relax automatically when the arm has completed it's bent arm fling. This is what causes the arm to straighten.

Item.name: fling2AngleMinL
Item.description: Min fling angle for left arm. Fling angle is random in the range fling2AngleMin:fling2AngleMax. Angle of fling in radians measured from the body horizontal sideways from shoulder. positive is up, 0 shoulder level, negative down

Item.name: fling2AngleMaxL
Item.description: Max fling angle for left arm

Item.name: fling2AngleMinR
Item.description: Min fling angle for right arm.

Item.name: fling2AngleMaxR
Item.description: Max fling angle for right arm

Item.name: fling2LengthMinL
Item.description: Min left arm length. Armlength is random in the range fling2LengthMin:fling2LengthMax. Armlength maps one to one with elbow angle. (These values are scaled internally for the female character)

Item.name: fling2LengthMaxL
Item.description: Max left arm length.

Item.name: fling2LengthMinR
Item.description: Min right arm length.

Item.name: fling2LengthMaxR
Item.description: Max right arm length.

Item.name: bust
Item.description: Has the character got a bust. If so then cupBust (move bust reach targets below bust) or bustElbowLift and cupSize (stop upperArm penetrating bust and move bust targets to surface of bust) are implemented.

Item.name: bustElbowLift
Item.description: Lift the elbows up this much extra to avoid upper arm penetrating the bust (when target hits spine2 or spine3)

Item.name: cupSize
Item.description: Amount reach target to bust (spine2) will be offset forward by

Item.name: cupBust
Item.description: All reach targets above or on the bust will cause a reach below the bust. (specifically moves spine3 and spine2 targets to spine1). bustElbowLift and cupSize are ignored.

Item.name: smartFall
Item.description: smartFall: Clone of High Fall with a wider range of operating conditions.

Item.name: bodyStiffness
Item.description: stiffness of body. Value feeds through to bodyBalance (synched with defaults), to armsWindmill (14 for this value at default ), legs pedal, head look and roll down stairs directly

Item.name: bodydamping
Item.description: The damping of the joints.

Item.name: catchfalltime
Item.description: The length of time before the impact that the character transitions to the landing.

Item.name: crashOrLandCutOff
Item.description: 0.52angle is 0.868 dot//A threshold for deciding how far away from upright the character needs to be before bailing out (going into a foetal) instead of trying to land (keeping stretched out). NB: never does bailout if ignorWorldCollisions true

Item.name: pdStrength
Item.description: Strength of the controller to keep the character at angle aimAngleBase from vertical.

Item.name: pdDamping
Item.description: Damping multiplier of the controller to keep the character at angle aimAngleBase from vertical. The actual damping is pdDamping*pdStrength*constant*angVel.

Item.name: armAngSpeed
Item.description: arm circling speed in armWindMillAdaptive

Item.name: armAmplitude
Item.description: in armWindMillAdaptive

Item.name: armPhase
Item.description: in armWindMillAdaptive 3.1 opposite for stuntman. 1.0 old default. 0.0 in phase.

Item.name: armBendElbows
Item.description: in armWindMillAdaptive bend the elbows as a function of armAngle. For stuntman true otherwise false.

Item.name: legRadius
Item.description: radius of legs on pedal

Item.name: legAngSpeed
Item.description: in pedal

Item.name: legAsymmetry
Item.description: 0.0 for stuntman. Random offset applied per leg to the angular speed to desynchronise the pedaling - set to 0 to disable, otherwise should be set to less than the angularSpeed value.

Item.name: arms2LegsPhase
Item.description: phase angle between the arms and legs circling angle

Item.name: arms2LegsSync
Item.description: 0=not synched, 1=always synched, 2= synch at start only. Synchs the arms angle to what the leg angle is. All speed/direction parameters of armswindmill are overwritten if = 1. If 2 and you want synced arms/legs then armAngSpeed=legAngSpeed, legAsymmetry = 0.0 (to stop randomizations of the leg cicle speed)

Item.name: armsUp
Item.description: Where to put the arms when preparing to land. Approx 1 = above head, 0 = head height, -1 = down. LT -2.0 use catchFall arms, LT -3.0 use prepare for landing pose if Agent is due to land vertically, feet first.

Item.name: orientateBodyToFallDirection
Item.description: toggle to orientate to fall direction. i.e. orientate so that the character faces the horizontal velocity direction

Item.name: orientateTwist
Item.description: If false don't worry about the twist angle of the character when orientating the character. If false this allows the twist axis of the character to be free (You can get a nice twisting highFall like the one in dieHard 4 when the car goes into the helicopter)

Item.name: orientateMax
Item.description: DEVEL parameter - suggest you don't edit it. Maximum torque the orientation controller can apply. If 0 then no helper torques will be used. 300 will orientate the character soflty for all but extreme angles away from aimAngleBase. If abs (current -aimAngleBase) is getting near 3.0 then this can be reduced to give a softer feel.

Item.name: alanRickman
Item.description: If true then orientate the character to face the point from where it started falling. HighFall like the one in dieHard with Alan Rickman

Item.name: fowardRoll
Item.description: Try to execute a forward Roll on landing

Item.name: useZeroPose_withFowardRoll
Item.description: Blend to a zero pose when forward roll is attempted.

Item.name: aimAngleBase
Item.description: Angle from vertical the pdController is driving to ( positive = forwards)

Item.name: fowardVelRotation
Item.description: scale to add/subtract from aimAngle based on forward speed (Internal)

Item.name: footVelCompScale
Item.description: Scale to change to amount of vel that is added to the foot ik from the velocity (Internal)

Item.name: sideD
Item.description: sideoffset for the feet during prepareForLanding. +ve = right.

Item.name: fowardOffsetOfLegIK
Item.description: Forward offset for the feet during prepareForLanding

Item.name: legL
Item.description: Leg Length for ik (Internal)//unused

Item.name: catchFallCutOff
Item.description: 0.5angle is 0.878 dot. Cutoff to go to the catchFall ( internal) //mmmtodo do like crashOrLandCutOff

Item.name: legStrength
Item.description: Strength of the legs at landing

Item.name: balance
Item.description: If true have enough strength to balance. If false not enough strength in legs to balance (even though bodyBlance called)

Item.name: ignorWorldCollisions
Item.description: Never go into bailout (foetal)

Item.name: adaptiveCircling
Item.description: stuntman type fall. Arm and legs circling direction controlled by angmom and orientation

Item.name: hula
Item.description: With stuntman type fall. Hula reaction if can't see floor and not rotating fast

Item.name: maxSpeedForRecoverableFall
Item.description: Character needs to be moving less than this speed to consider fall as a recoverable one.

Item.name: minSpeedForBrace
Item.description: Character needs to be moving at least this fast horizontally to start bracing for impact if there is an object along its trajectory.

Item.name: landingNormal
Item.description: Ray-cast normal doted with up direction has to be greater than this number to consider object flat enough to land on it.

Item.name: rdsTargetLinVeDecayTime
Item.description: RDS: Time for the targetlinearVelocity to decay to zero.

Item.name: rdsTargetLinearVelocity
Item.description: RDS: Helper torques are applied to match the spin of the character to the max of targetLinearVelocity and COMVelMag. -1 to use initial character velocity.

Item.name: rdsUseStartingFriction
Item.description: Start Catch Fall/RDS state with specified friction. Catch fall will overwrite based on setFallingReaction.

Item.name: rdsStartingFriction
Item.description: Catch Fall/RDS starting friction. Catch fall will overwrite based on setFallingReaction.

Item.name: rdsStartingFrictionMin
Item.description: Catch Fall/RDS starting friction minimum. Catch fall will overwrite based on setFallingReaction.

Item.name: rdsForceVelThreshold
Item.description: Velocity threshold under which RDS force mag will be applied.

Item.name: initialState
Item.description: Force initial state (used in vehicle bail out to start SF_CatchFall (6) earlier.

Item.name: changeExtremityFriction
Item.description: Allow friction changes to be applied to the hands and feet.

Item.name: teeter
Item.description: Set up an immediate teeter in the direction of trave if initial state is SF_Balance.

Item.name: teeterOffset
Item.description: Offset the default Teeter edge in the direction of travel. Will need to be tweaked depending on how close to the real edge AI tends to trigger the behaviour.

Item.name: stopRollingTime
Item.description: Time in seconds before ped should start actively trying to stop rolling.

Item.name: reboundScale
Item.description: Scale for rebound assistance. 0=off, 1=very bouncy, 2=jbone crazy Try 0.5?

Item.name: reboundMask
Item.description: Part mask to apply rebound assistance.

Item.name: forceHeadAvoid
Item.description: Force head avoid to be active during Catch Fall even when character is not on the ground.

Item.name: cfZAxisSpinReduction
Item.description: Pass-through parameter for Catch Fall spin reduction. Increase to stop more spin. 0..1.

Item.name: splatWhenStopped
Item.description: Transition to splat state when com vel is below value, regardless of character health or fall velocity. Set to zero to disable.

Item.name: blendHeadWhenStopped
Item.description: Blend head to neutral pose com vel approaches zero. Linear between zero and value. Set to zero to disable.

Item.name: spreadLegs
Item.description: Spread legs amount for Pedal during fall.

Item.name: staggerFall
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: armStiffness
Item.description: stiffness of arms. catch_fall's stiffness scales with this value, but has default values when this is default

Item.name: armDamping
Item.description: Sets damping value for the arms

Item.name: armStiffnessStart
Item.description: armStiffness during the yanked timescale ie timeAtStartValues

Item.name: armDampingStart
Item.description: armDamping during the yanked timescale ie timeAtStartValues

Item.name: spineDampingStart
Item.description: spineDamping during the yanked timescale ie timeAtStartValues

Item.name: spineStiffnessStart
Item.description: spineStiffness during the yanked timescale ie timeAtStartValues

Item.name: timeAtStartValues
Item.description: time spent with Start values for arms and spine stiffness and damping ie for whiplash efffect

Item.name: rampTimeFromStartValues
Item.description: time spent ramping from Start to end values for arms and spine stiffness and damping ie for whiplash efffect (occurs after timeAtStartValues)

Item.name: staggerStepProb
Item.description: Probability per step of time spent in a stagger step

Item.name: stepsTillStartEnd
Item.description: steps taken before lowerBodyStiffness starts ramping down by perStepReduction1

Item.name: timeStartEnd
Item.description: time from start of behaviour before lowerBodyStiffness starts ramping down for rampTimeToEndValues to endValues

Item.name: rampTimeToEndValues
Item.description: time spent ramping from lowerBodyStiffness to lowerBodyStiffnessEnd

Item.name: lowerBodyStiffness
Item.description: lowerBodyStiffness should be 12

Item.name: lowerBodyStiffnessEnd
Item.description: lowerBodyStiffness at end

Item.name: predictionTime
Item.description: amount of time (seconds) into the future that the character tries to step to. bigger values try to recover with fewer, bigger steps. smaller values recover with smaller steps, and generally recover less.

Item.name: perStepReduction1
Item.description: LowerBody stiffness will be reduced every step to make the character fallover

Item.name: leanInDirRate
Item.description: leanInDirection will be increased from 0 to leanInDirMax linearly at this rate

Item.name: leanInDirMaxF
Item.description: Max of leanInDirection magnitude when going forwards

Item.name: leanInDirMaxB
Item.description: Max of leanInDirection magnitude when going backwards

Item.name: leanHipsMaxF
Item.description: Max of leanInDirectionHips magnitude when going forwards

Item.name: leanHipsMaxB
Item.description: Max of leanInDirectionHips magnitude when going backwards

Item.name: lean2multF
Item.description: Lean of spine to side in side velocity direction when going forwards

Item.name: lean2multB
Item.description: Lean of spine to side in side velocity direction when going backwards

Item.name: pushOffDist
Item.description: amount stance foot is behind com in the direction of velocity before the leg tries to pushOff to increase momentum. Increase to lower the probability of the pushOff making the character bouncy

Item.name: maxPushoffVel
Item.description: stance leg will only pushOff to increase momentum if the vertical hip velocity is less than this value. 0.4 seems like a good value. The higher it is the the less this functionality is applied. If it is very low or negative this can stop the pushOff altogether

Item.name: hipBendMult
Item.description: hipBend scaled with velocity

Item.name: alwaysBendForwards
Item.description: bend forwards at the hip (hipBendMult) whether moving backwards or forwards

Item.name: spineBendMult
Item.description: spine bend scaled with velocity

Item.name: useHeadLook
Item.description: enable and provide a look-at target to make the character's head turn to face it while balancing, balancer default is 0.2

Item.name: headLookPos
Item.description: position of thing to look at

Item.name: headLookInstanceIndex
Item.description: level index of thing to look at

Item.name: headLookAtVelProb
Item.description: Probability [0-1] that headLook will be looking in the direction of velocity when stepping

Item.name: turnOffProb
Item.description: Weighted Probability that turn will be off. This is one of six turn type weights.

Item.name: turn2TargetProb
Item.description: Weighted Probability of turning towards headLook target. This is one of six turn type weights.

Item.name: turn2VelProb
Item.description: Weighted Probability of turning towards velocity. This is one of six turn type weights.

Item.name: turnAwayProb
Item.description: Weighted Probability of turning away from headLook target. This is one of six turn type weights.

Item.name: turnLeftProb
Item.description: Weighted Probability of turning left. This is one of six turn type weights.

Item.name: turnRightProb
Item.description: Weighted Probability of turning right. This is one of six turn type weights.

Item.name: useBodyTurn
Item.description: enable and provide a positive bodyTurnTimeout and provide a look-at target to make the character turn to face it while balancing

Item.name: upperBodyReaction
Item.description: enable upper body reaction ie blindBrace and armswindmill

Item.name: teeter
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: edgeLeft
Item.description: Defines the left edge point (left of character facing edge)

Item.name: edgeRight
Item.description: Defines the right edge point (right of character facing edge)

Item.name: useExclusionZone
Item.description: stop stepping across the line defined by edgeLeft and edgeRight

Item.name: callHighFall
Item.description: call highFall if fallen over the edge. If false just call blended writhe (to go over the top of the fall behaviour of the underlying behaviour e.g. bodyBalance)

Item.name: leanAway
Item.description: lean away from the edge based on velocity towards the edge (if closer than 2m from edge)

Item.name: preTeeterTime
Item.description: Time-to-edge threshold to start pre-teeter (windmilling, etc).

Item.name: leanAwayTime
Item.description: Time-to-edge threshold to start leaning away from a potential fall.

Item.name: leanAwayScale
Item.description: Scales stay upright lean and hip pitch.

Item.name: teeterTime
Item.description: Time-to-edge threshold to start full-on teeter (more aggressive lean, drop-and-twist, etc).

Item.name: upperBodyFlinch
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: handDistanceLeftRight
Item.description: Left-Right distance between the hands

Item.name: handDistanceFrontBack
Item.description: Front-Back distance between the hands

Item.name: handDistanceVertical
Item.description: Vertical distance between the hands

Item.name: bodyStiffness
Item.description: stiffness of body. Value carries over to head look, spine twist

Item.name: bodyDamping
Item.description: damping value used for upper body

Item.name: backBendAmount
Item.description: Amount to bend the back during the flinch

Item.name: useRightArm
Item.description: Toggle to use the right arm.

Item.name: useLeftArm
Item.description: Toggle to Use the Left arm

Item.name: noiseScale
Item.description: Amplitude of the perlin noise applied to the arms positions in the flicnh to the front part of the behaviour.

Item.name: newHit
Item.description: Relaxes the character for 1 frame if set.

Item.name: protectHeadToggle
Item.description: Always protect head. Note if false then character flinches if target is in front, protects head if target is behind

Item.name: dontBraceHead
Item.description: don't protect head only brace from front. Turned on by bcr

Item.name: applyStiffness
Item.description: Turned of by bcr

Item.name: headLookAwayFromTarget
Item.description: Look away from target (unless protecting head then look between feet)

Item.name: useHeadLook
Item.description: Use headlook

Item.name: turnTowards
Item.description: ve balancer turn Towards, negative balancer turn Away, 0 balancer won't turn. NB.There is a 50% chance that the character will not turn even if this parameter is set to turn

Item.name: pos
Item.description: position in world-space of object to flinch from

Item.name: yanked
Item.description: ... (check docs)

Item.name: armStiffness
Item.description: stiffness of arms when upright.

Item.name: armDamping
Item.description: Sets damping value for the arms when upright.

Item.name: spineDamping
Item.description: Spine Damping when upright.

Item.name: spineStiffness
Item.description: Spine Stiffness when upright..

Item.name: armStiffnessStart
Item.description: armStiffness during the yanked timescale ie timeAtStartValues

Item.name: armDampingStart
Item.description: armDamping during the yanked timescale ie timeAtStartValues

Item.name: spineDampingStart
Item.description: spineDamping during the yanked timescale ie timeAtStartValues

Item.name: spineStiffnessStart
Item.description: spineStiffness during the yanked timescale ie timeAtStartValues

Item.name: timeAtStartValues
Item.description: time spent with Start values for arms and spine stiffness and damping ie for whiplash efffect

Item.name: rampTimeFromStartValues
Item.description: time spent ramping from Start to end values for arms and spine stiffness and damping ie for whiplash efffect (occurs after timeAtStartValues)

Item.name: stepsTillStartEnd
Item.description: steps taken before lowerBodyStiffness starts ramping down

Item.name: timeStartEnd
Item.description: time from start of behaviour before lowerBodyStiffness starts ramping down by perStepReduction1

Item.name: rampTimeToEndValues
Item.description: time spent ramping from lowerBodyStiffness to lowerBodyStiffnessEnd

Item.name: lowerBodyStiffness
Item.description: lowerBodyStiffness should be 12

Item.name: lowerBodyStiffnessEnd
Item.description: lowerBodyStiffness at end

Item.name: perStepReduction
Item.description: LowerBody stiffness will be reduced every step to make the character fallover

Item.name: hipPitchForward
Item.description: Amount to bend forward at the hips (+ve forward, -ve backwards). Behaviour switches between hipPitchForward and hipPitchBack

Item.name: hipPitchBack
Item.description: Amount to bend backwards at the hips (+ve backwards, -ve forwards). Behaviour switches between hipPitchForward and hipPitchBack

Item.name: spineBend
Item.description: Bend/Twist the spine amount

Item.name: footFriction
Item.description: Foot friction when standing/stepping. 0.5 gives a good slide sometimes

Item.name: turnThresholdMin
Item.description: min angle at which the turn with toggle to the other direction (actual toggle angle is chosen randomly in range min to max). If it is 1 then it will never toggle. If negative then no turn is applied.

Item.name: turnThresholdMax
Item.description: max angle at which the turn with toggle to the other direction (actual toggle angle is chosen randomly in range min to max). If it is 1 then it will never toggle. If negative then no turn is applied.

Item.name: useHeadLook
Item.description: enable and provide a look-at target to make the character's head turn to face it while balancing

Item.name: headLookPos
Item.description: position of thing to look at

Item.name: headLookInstanceIndex
Item.description: level index of thing to look at

Item.name: headLookAtVelProb
Item.description: Probability [0-1] that headLook will be looking in the direction of velocity when stepping

Item.name: comVelRDSThresh
Item.description: for handsAndKnees catchfall ONLY: comVel above which rollDownstairs will start

Item.name: hulaPeriod
Item.description: 0.25 A complete wiggle will take 4*hulaPeriod

Item.name: hipAmplitude
Item.description: Amount of hip movement

Item.name: spineAmplitude
Item.description: Amount of spine movement

Item.name: minRelaxPeriod
Item.description: wriggle relaxes for a minimum of minRelaxPeriod (if it is negative it is a multiplier on the time previously spent wriggling)

Item.name: maxRelaxPeriod
Item.description: wriggle relaxes for a maximum of maxRelaxPeriod (if it is negative it is a multiplier on the time previously spent wriggling)

Item.name: rollHelp
Item.description: Amount of cheat torque applied to turn the character over

Item.name: groundLegStiffness
Item.description: Leg Stiffness when on the ground

Item.name: groundArmStiffness
Item.description: Arm Stiffness when on the ground

Item.name: groundSpineStiffness
Item.description: Spine Stiffness when on the ground

Item.name: groundLegDamping
Item.description: Leg Damping when on the ground

Item.name: groundArmDamping
Item.description: Arm Damping when on the ground

Item.name: groundSpineDamping
Item.description: Spine Damping when on the ground

Item.name: groundFriction
Item.description: Friction multiplier on bodyParts when on ground. Character can look too slidy with groundFriction = 1. Higher values give a more jerky reation but this seems timestep dependent especially for dragged by the feet.
